Title: Provincial Education Lead – Short-Term

Functional Area: Program– Learn

Reports to: Direct- Provincial Head; Matrix (dotted)- Education Lead

Location: Janakpur, Madhesh Province

Travel Required: Yes

Grade: D1

Type: Open to all applicants, Short-Term employment until March 2026; based in Madhesh Province

ABOUT PLAN INTERNATIONAL NEPAL:

Plan International is a development and humanitarian organization dedicated to advancing children’s rights and achieving equality for girls. With a presence in over 75 countries, we work alongside children, young people, supporters, and partners to create a just world. Our work is guided by core values such as transparency, accountability, collaboration, inclusion, and the overarching ambition to empower girls and young women as part of our legacy.

Plan International has been operating in Nepal since 1978, earning a strong reputation as a trusted development and humanitarian actor. Over the years, we have worked in 23 districts across the country, helping marginalized children, their families, and communities access their rights to health, education, economic security, and protection.

Committed to feminist leadership and a gender-transformative approach, Plan International Nepal collaborates with local partners to ensure sustainable impact and foster equality, particularly for girls and young women.

Plan International Nepal strives for an inclusive, just, and safe society that advances children’s rights and equality for girls. Our mission from 2023 to 2028 is to see all girls and young women standing strong enjoying their rights, and freedom with dignity in Nepal.

Plan International Nepal is looking for candidates who embrace feminist leadership, value diversity, and are driven to find innovative solutions to challenges. Ideal candidates should respectfully and boldly share their ideas, foster cross-department collaboration, practice active listening, uphold confidentiality, build trust, and demonstrate a strong passion for advancing children’s rights and promoting equality for girls.

ROLE PURPOSE:

The Provincial Education Lead will serve as a province-level technical advisor to the Mahesh Provincial government to provide technical leadership, coordination, and strategic guidance to support effective implementation of education components of the Samartha Programme. The position holder will work closely with the Ministry of Education and Social Development (MoESD) and Education Development Directorate, Education Development and Coordination Units (EDCUs), other relevant line ministries, provincial authorities, local governments, schools, universities, private sector, and development partners to strengthen education governance, improve learning outcomes, and promote inclusive and equitable education services.

The Provincial Lead will ensure alignment of programme interventions with provincial and national priorities and promote innovative, evidence-based approaches tailored to local needs. This role requires a technically sound education professional with a deep understanding of Nepal’s education system and experience in education programme implementation, government collaboration, and systems strengthening. The Provincial Education Lead will work closely with the federal technical team, cluster staff, and provincial counterparts to provide evidence-based, inclusive, and sustainable education interventions.

DIMENSIONS OF THE ROLE:
Description
ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Technical Leadership and Strategic Implementation (60%):

  • Provide technical support on the design, implementation, and adaptation of the programme’s education sector interventions in Madhesh Province, with a focus on foundational learning, inclusive education, and system strengthening aligned with national and provincial policies, plans and frameworks.
  • Maintain an up-to-date understanding of local, provincial and federal education policies, reforms, and coordination mechanisms, ensuring programme strategies remain contextually appropriate and aligned with sectoral priorities.
  • Provide necessary technical support to capacitate LGs in use of Education Management Information System (EMIS) in Local Education Plan (LEP), annual plans, policy and budgeting.
  • Support the development and contextualisation of tools, resources, and implementation approaches that promote equitable and quality education, informed by local needs and national as well as international best practices in strengthening education systems.
  • Support subnational stakeholders to uptake Samartha’s interventions such as out of school children mapping and retention, school improvement, scholarships, integrating inclusive disability education etc.
  • Collaborate closely with thematic leads in health, GEDSI, governance, and Innovation, Evidence and Learning (IEL) to ensure cross-sectoral coherence, synergy and integration across Samartha’s interventions in Madhesh Province.
  • Promote the application and monitoring of quality assurance mechanisms in teaching, learning, and school governance, contributing to measurable improvements in learning outcomes and institutional performance.
  • Identify and address systemic barriers to access, equity and quality in promoting the inclusive quality education service delivery; support adaptive programming through the use of evidence and ongoing learning.
  • Provide technical backstopping to education and cross-sectoral teams across clusters and local governments, in response to emerging priorities and operational needs.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentoring support to the local education experts of Samartha.
  • Support the Provincial Education Training Center in conducting teacher’s training need assessment with special focus on GEDSI responsive education and provide required support for strengthening teacher’s support mechanism.
  • Undertake any other technical assistance support as assigned to support the effective delivery of Samartha in Madhesh Province.

Coordination and Stakeholder Engagement (15%):

  • Maintain strategic, respectful and collaborative relationships with the MoESD, Education Development Directorate, EDCU, local governments, and other relevant provincial stakeholders to support alignment and joint ownership of education sector priorities in Madhesh Province.
  • Represent the Samartha programme in provincial-level education forums, technical committees, working groups, and multi-stakeholder platforms, ensuring visibility, policy coherence and effective contribution to education sector coordination mechanisms.
  • Facilitate communication and coordination between the Samartha technical team at national level, provincial and municipal education stakeholders to promote integrated planning, implementation, and adaptive learning processes.
  • Support joint planning exercises, implementation reviews and structured learning dialogues with provincial and local government actors to strengthen education sector governance and institutional capacity for GEDSI responsive service delivery.
  • Provide technical and advisory support to local governments, EDCU, Education Development Directorate in the preparation, revision and operationalisation of
  • Provincial Education Master Plan and Local Education Plan (LEP), ensuring contextual appropriateness, inclusivity and alignment with national education priorities envisioned in School Education Sector Plan.
  • Coordinate with other British Embassy Kathmandu funded programmes and with other development partner programmes.

Innovation, Evidence, and Learning (IEL) with Reporting (10%):

  • Contribute to the generation, interpretation and utilisation of data and evidence to inform the design, delivery and continuous improvement of education interventions, with particular attention to equity, inclusion, learning outcomes and GEDSI responsive service delivery system performance.
  • Work closely with the IEL team to track the progress of effectiveness, inclusiveness and responsiveness of education related activities and targets.
  • Document lessons learned, innovative practices, implementation challenges and success factors to support internal reflection and learning, as well as sharing of knowledge products with proven evidence (as relevant).
  • Contribute to the preparation of technical reports, policy briefs, case studies and other knowledge products related to education programming in Mahesh Province.

Capacity Strengthening and Systems Support (15%):

  • Identify capacity gaps and systemic bottlenecks existing in the current social sector service delivery particularly in the education sector at subnational level.
  • Coordinate closely with the EDCU, the Provincial Directorate of Education, Education Training Center and other relevant authorities to ensure that identified capacity-building needs of local governments are assessed and addressed in a strategic way.
  • Sensitise and capacitate the education service providers at province/ cluster/ local level on how to effectively prioritise GEDSI concern on planning, budgeting and decision-making processes, thereby strengthening local ownership and accountability on service delivery.
  • Plan and facilitate training sessions, learning sharing events, mentoring and on-the-job coaching on priority themes such as foundational learning, inclusive education, school leadership and data-informed planning.
  • Support the development, contextualisation and dissemination of technical tools, operational guidelines and capacity-building modules that are responsive to the evolving needs of subnational education governance in Madhesh Province.

Other:

  • Carry out other related tasks assigned by the supervisor.
  • Ensures the full integration of Plan International’s global policies on Safeguarding Children, Program Participants, and Gender Equality and Inclusion (DEI) within their area of responsibility. This includes adherence to the policy principles, relevant Implementation Standards, and Guidelines. Key responsibilities involve ensuring that staff and associates are informed of and understand their obligations under these policies and Plan International’s Code of Conduct (CoC), their relevance to their specific roles, and that any concerns are promptly reported and managed in line with established procedures.

TECHNICAL EXPERTISE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:

Essential Knowledge and Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience with a Masters’ Degree or 7 years with Bachelors’ Degree Education, Educational Planning, Public Policy or any other related field.
  • Must have working experience in education sector planning, budgeting and promoting inclusive education programme, including at least 3 years working experience in a technical or advisory role.
  • Proven experience working with local, provincial and federal level government, particularly for implementation of education sector programme.
  • Familiarity with Nepal’s education system, federal level education governance structure and education sector policies, plans and priority programmes.
  • Experience with donor funded education programmes is preferred.
  • Knowledge of basic MS Office including MS Outlook, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills in English and Nepali.

Skills (leadership/managerial if applicable):

  • Strong understanding of education governance, foundational learning, inclusive and disability education and school-based planning.
  • Excellent facilitation, coordination and communication skills.
  • Proficiency in data use for education planning and decision-making.
  • Fluency in Nepali and English is mandatory (both spoken and written); however, knowledge on local language such as Maithali or Bhojpuri will be an advantage.
  • High integrity, diverse cultural sensitivity and commitment to promote inclusive education principles.

Behaviours:

  • Demonstrable professional maturity and able to work independently.
  • Based in Madhesh Province with extensive travel to cluster areas and local governments.
  • Candidates with a valid driving license is a distinct advantage.
  • Strong personal commitment to gender equality, social inclusion and strengthening of public education systems through evidence-based approaches.
  • Ability to work independently in complex and evolving political and institutional environments.
  • Ability to apply good judgment and professionalism in the resolution of work-related problems.
  • Willingness to work under pressure and adapt to changing contexts.
  • Honest, encourages openness and transparency.
  • Efficient in meeting commitments and deadlines in achieving results.
  • Ability to plan and organize work by identifying priority activities and adjusting priorities as required.
  • Demonstrated approach to work that is characterized by commitment, motivation, energy and flexibility.
  • Ability to relate to government authorities and other development/humanitarian actors and to build a rapport effectively.
  • Commitment to Plan’s values including the rights and needs of children.

PLAN INTERNATIONAL’S VALUES IN PRACTICE:

We are open and accountable

  • We create a climate of trust inside and outside the organization by being open, honest and transparent. We hold ourselves and others to account for the decisions we make and for our impact on others, while doing what we say we will do.

We strive for lasting impact

  • We strive to achieve significant and lasting impact on the lives of children and young people, and to secure equality for girls. We challenge ourselves to be bold, courageous, responsive, focused and innovative.

We work well together

We succeed by working effectively with others, inside and outside the organisation, including our sponsors and donors. We actively support our colleagues, helping them to achieve their goals. We come together to create and implement solutions in our teams, across Plan International, with children, girls, young people, communities and our partners.

We are inclusive and empowering

We respect all people, appreciate differences and challenge inequality in our programmes and our workplace. We support children, girls and young people to increase their confidence and to change their own lives. We empower our staff to give their best and develop their potential.

PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT:

This position is based in Janakpur, Madhesh Province, with frequent travel to project areas.

LEVEL OF CONTACT WITH CHILDREN:

High level: Frequent interaction with children.

“Say Yes ! To Keeping Children and Young people safe and Protected”

title.rendered: Medical Centre Nurse, Residential Home Nurse

content.rendered:
The Gurkha Welfare Trust Nepal is the field arm of The Gurkha Welfare Trust UK, a registered charitable Trust working, particularly for the ex-Gurkha Veterans and their communities across Nepal. It is a charitable institution that was established and registered in the UK in 1969. We are currently seeking applications from suitably qualified and committed individuals for the following positions:

  •  Medical Centre Nurse based at Area Welfare Centre (AWC) Dharan in Shivadhara, Dharan.
  •  Residential Home Nurse based at Ram Bahadur Limbu VC Residential Home Dharan, co-located in AWC Dharan.

1. MEDICAL CENTRE NURSE:

Key Responsibilities:

The Medical Centre Nurse is responsible for the delivery of competent and professional primary health care service, in collaboration with other AWC clinical staff, supporting the Clinical Practice Manager. She will work with the Clients to ensure their needs and perceptions are met and that GWT is delivering the expected and agreed level of service.

Please read through the Job Description for further information on job responsibilities.

Essential and Desirable Criteria:

  • Minimum of bachelor’s degree in nursing or BSc Nursing with at least 2 years’ experience in Hospital or community setting post qualification.
  •  Alternatively, for internal promotion, PCL in nursing with at least 6 years working experience since qualification, of which at least 2 years in GWT.
  •  Current unrestricted registration with the Nepal Nursing Council.
  •  Comprehensive knowledge and skills in general nursing care and basic pharmacology.
  •  Prior experience working with I/NGOs and/or geriatric care or palliative care is highly desirable.

2. RESIDENTIAL HOME NURSE:

Key Responsibilities:

The Residential Home Nurse works as part of a team to provide and maintain professional standards in accordance with the principles of care as set out by the guidelines of the GWT and the Nepal Nursing Council. The postholder takes responsibility for the day-to-day implementation of the care tasks appertaining to the holistic and specifically the nursing needs of the residents in the Residential Home.

lease read through the Job Description for further information on job responsibilities.

Essential and Desirable Criteria:

  •  Minimum of bachelor’s degree in nursing or BSc Nursing with at least 2 years’ experience in Hospital or community setting post qualification.
  • Alternatively, for internal promotion, PCL in nursing with at least 6 years working experience since qualification, of which at least 2 years in GWT.
  • Current unrestricted registration with the Nepal Nursing Council.
  •  Comprehensive knowledge and skills in general nursing care and basic pharmacology.
  •  Prior experience working with I/NGOs and/or residential home environment is highly desirable.

REMUNERATIONS:

  • Both the Medical Centre Nurse and Residential Home Nurse positions fall in EG3L1 in our pay structure, with a basic monthly salary of NPR 72,237. Prevailing salary, or whichever is higher, is applicable for internal candidates transferring level.
  • Additional benefits and entitlements will be provided in line with the GWT Nepal’s Standing Instructions (SI). The initial appointment will be for a three-year contract, with the potential for extension subject to organisational requirements and individual performance.

ELIGIBILITY AND APPLICATIONS:

Qualified, eligible, and interested applicants are invited to submit their applications by Thursday, 01 January 2026.

Internal candidates are to refer to Chapters 6.10.17 to 6.10.20 of the SI for details regarding eligibility criteria for level transfer and promotion.

The Gurkha Welfare Trust Nepal is an equal opportunity employer

Position: Knowledge Management and Monitoring Trainee
Project: InElam
Duration: 6 Months
Location: Madhesh, Birgunj

1. Background

InElam, a project implemented by Helvetas Nepal, has promoted sustainable livelihoods through small enterprise development in Karnali and Madhesh Province. The current phase focuses on green jobs and circular economy principles to support small, environment-friendly enterprises that generate income for women, youth, and
marginalized communities. Central to this mission is our ability to effectively monitor our projects, learn from our experiences, and systematically manage our knowledge to enhance program quality and impact.

To strengthen our organizational capacity in this area and to cultivate new talent, we are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Knowledge Management and Monitoring
Trainee. This role offers an opportunity to gain professional experience in the core processes of monitoring, evaluation, and learning (MEL) and knowledge management (KM) within a development organization.

Key Responsibilities

Under the direct supervision of Knowledge Management and Monitoring Officer, the trainee will be responsible for the following:

a. Assist in collecting, cleaning, and entering program data from field activities.
b. Helping to track project progress against targets using tools such as Excel or other software.
c. Prepare data for reports, presentations, and reviews by the Project Coordinator
(PC), Knowledge Management Officer (KMO), Team Leader (TL), and Country Office (CO).
d. Create charts, graphs, and dashboards to visualize data.
e. Conduct regular field monitoring visits and data collection activities.
f. Assist in documenting and archiving key project documents, including reports and success stories.
g. Support the maintenance and upkeep of internal knowledge platforms (e.g., SharePoint).
h. Assist in drafting knowledge products such as newsletters, blogs, and presentations.
i. Help organize and facilitate team learning meetings and workshops.
j. Maintain a clear and simple digital filing system for project documents Assist in drafting knowledge products such as newsletters, blogs, and presentations.

3. Qualification and Competencies

i. Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as International Development, Social Sciences, Business Administration, Information Management,
Communications, Statistics, or related discipline. Fresh graduates with no prior job experience are especially encouraged to apply. Willingness for extensive field travel in project areas.
ii. Strong interest in knowledge management, organizational learning, monitoring & evaluation, and international development/humanitarian work.
iii. Excellent organizational skills and a keen eye for detail.
iv. Good numerical and analytical skills, comfort with working with data.
v. Basic Knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel and PowerPoint) is essential. Familiarity with data collection tool like KOBO or
design tools (e.g., Canva) is a plus.
vi. Good written and verbal communication skills in English and Nepali.
vii. Ability to work collaboratively in a team as well as independently on assigned tasks.
viii. Proactive, eager to learn, and able to manage multiple tasks effectively.

Interested candidates should submit their CV along with a cover letter expressing how their motivation and skills match the role to inelam.np@helvetas.org with the subject line “Application: Knowledge Management and Monitoring Trainee” by 4th January 2025 before 5:00 PM.

Preservation of Environment and Social Welfare of Nepal (PESWAN) is implementing Resilience Future: Ending Child Marriage in Nepal Project for approximately 2 years in Bhimdatta and Dodhara Chadani Municipality of Kanchanpur districts with Partnership of Plan International Nepal. Resilient Future: Ending Child Marriage Project focuses on enabling children, adolescents, and youth—especially girls and those from marginalized groups—to understand the connection between climate change and harmful practices such as child, early, and forced marriage (CEFM). The project raises awareness about gender-based vulnerabilities to climate change, its impacts on the environment, livelihoods, and health, and the correlation with CEFM. It works to prevent CEFM and promotes climate-resilient and adaptive economic activities for young women and vulnerable families—such as climate-resilient agriculture and gender-responsive financial services.

Position: Project Coordinator

Required- 1 (One)

Type: Full-time

Duty Station: PESWAN head office, Mahendranagar Kanchanpur with frequent field visit to project site.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Ensure implementation of Resilient Future-Ending Child Marriage project activities at district and Municipality/wards level, lead implementation adhering to project standards according to Detailed Implementation Plan (DIP) and Milestone.
  • Provide necessary support to staff members for maintaining good coordination and cooperation with district level agencies and seek required support from government and other stakeholders at district and field level.
  • Work closely with Administration & Finance Officer and MERL Officer for proper documentation of financial requirements, budgeting & financial reporting, data collection, analysis and storage.
  • Assure project activities are on time, target and budget and periodic recommendations from technical team and PI staff are implemented adhering standards.
  • Provide support to project staff to enhance their knowledge, capacity and awareness of prevent child, early and force marriage, mainstreaming in local planning process.
  • Support Project Officers, Social Mobilizers to organize events/workshops/trainings at district, municipality and community level.
  • Capacity building of supervisee staff’s on GESI, safeguarding, budget planning, monitoring and quality assurance of implemented activities.
  • Trained community and religious leaders, government officials to prevent child, early and force marriage.
  • Prepare work plans (Monthly, Quarterly & Annual) with budget projection of the project and submit to PI.
  • Prepare and submit (Quarterly / Annual Progress Report) as per agreed time to PI.
  • Support staff on preparation of case studies / success stories writing, reports and documents to capture project learning’s and good practices.
  • Coordinate closely with Monitoring, Evaluation, Research and Learning officer to generate and collect required information and data in the process of measuring results of program intervention.
  • Supervise financial reporting and assure Monthly Financial Report and other documents related to finance & compliance are prepared and submitted to Finance Department/ PI.
  • Closely follow-up and ensure all information, documentation and reporting requirements are met and submitted to PI through appropriate means as and when required.
  • As required by the project, liaise with and represent the program’s components to local government officials, civil society/community leaders and other key stakeholders in the district and municipality.
  • Establish good coordination & collaboration with government and non-government stakeholders to optimize project support and energy.
  • Plan & lead to organize regular learning sharing meetings and monitoring visits to program areas, share program progress, receive feedback from concerned agencies, and implement them.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other projects in the district, District Coordination Committee (DCC), District Project Advisory Committee (DPAC) members, Municipalities, local communities and project beneficiaries to achieve the overall goal of community resilience through coordinated planning and allocation of resources.

Required experience and qualifications:

  • Master’s in Social Science, Development Studies, Public Administration, Rural Development, Disaster Risk Management (DRM) or related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in project coordination or management preferably in DRM, Climate Change (CC), Resilient Agricultural Practices,
  • Entrepreneurs, Child protection and Child Early and Forced Marriage (CEFM).
  • Familiar with government policies and priorities in Protection, CEFM, Agriculture, DRM and CC.
  • Excellent facilitation skill of meetings, orientation, training and workshop.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to liaise with government officials and stakeholders.
  • Proficient in written and spoken English and Nepali language.
  • Basic computer skills (MS package, email, outlook).

Application: Interested candidates should submit all documents outlined above to email vacancy.peswan@gmail.com or hard copy to PESWAN head office, Bhimdatt Municipality 18 Katan by 25 December 2025. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for the further process.

Note: Please mention the position that you are applying for in the subject line.

content.rendered:
Feminist Dalit Organization (FEDO) is a pioneer organization in Nepal to advocate Dalit’s rights and women’s rights simultaneously. FEDO envisions just and equitable society, and puts Dalit women at the core of its all initiatives. Its actions are dedicated to economic empowerment, human rights and access to justice, leadership development, inclusive governance and social justice, and gender responsive humanitarian assistance for Dalits, women and the most vulnerable population in Nepal. Its organizational presence is expanded to 77 districts and all seven provinces of Nepal. FEDO has also been working with national and international networks and platforms of women and Dalits. Now, FEDO has been implementing the Project in partnership of Bread for the World (BfTW) named “Strengthening Governance for Development and Social Justice of Dalit Women” – Continuation at Doti, Dhanusha and Kaski District.

In this connection, we are currently seeking qualified, competent, creative, committed and highly motivated candidates for the following positions to support in Strengthening Governance for Development and Social Justice of Dalit Women” – Continuation Project activities at the local Level. Therefore, FEDO would like invite applications from eligible Nepali citizens for the following 2 positions in Kaski and Dhanusha Districts.

District Project Coordinator – 1 – Kaski District

Basic Job Information:

Employment Type: Full Time

Duty Station: Kaski

Offered Salary: Negotiable

Overall Purpose of the Position:

The District Project Coordinator shall be responsible for overall leadership and management of programs and administration of project in the project District. S/he shall lead the planning, implementation, and monitoring and evaluation of all activities of the project and organization at district level. S/he shall ensure all quality assurance of project activity implementation and reporting.

The position will be based in FEDO’s Kaski district chapter, with 10 percent travel outside working district.

Main Tasks and Responsibilities of the Position:

The major responsibility of District Project Coordinator is to coordinate with government, formal and informal justice actors and other like-minded organizations and individuals to implement the project activities in respective districts towards achieving the results. The following are the other task of position;

  • Support planning and implementation of project activities related to mobilize community people especially Dalit women and people from other excluded groups and strengthen their capacity to promote and protect the human rights of Dalit women at the local level in project district.
  • Coordinate with local and provincial government, human rights institutions, justice actors, political parties and civil society organizations accountable and responsive to increase the access to social justice and socio-economic rights for Dalit women.
  • Prepare budget plan and track expenditures/transactions in the coordination and consultation with Project Manager and Executive Director.
  • Supervise Project assistants and provide them technical guidance to mobilize Dalit women groups, Dalit women frontline leaders as well as community people.
  • Support to establish justice support mechanism through groups and frontline leaders at the local level and function it to handle and manage the cases of gender-based violence (GBV) and caste-based discrimination and untouchability (CBDU) in terms of increasing the access to justice of Dalit women
  • Schedule and organize meetings/ events, prepare paperwork and other required task in advocacy efforts for strengthening the human rights of Dalit women
  • Keep updated cases of violence and discrimination, and prepare evidence-based report

Minimum Requirements:

  • Completed Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, management, development studies (or equivalent) with at least three (3) years working experience in senior management position of non-profit organization.
  • The working experience in Dalit and marginalized women led or women rights organizations will be added value.

Knowledge and skills needed:

  • Experience in human rights, advocacy and dealing with advocacy forums/networking for promoting and protecting the human rights of Dalit women and other excluded groups
  • At least three years’ experience in implementation and providing skillful knowledge on law and policies, strengthening capacities of frontline leaders and advocates
  • Experience in conducting trainings for community legal empowerment, women rights and advocacy campaigns
  • Good understanding of the human right situation, socio-economic, legal and political context of Nepal, Dalit women movement and current debates and issues
  • Competent in computer skills, esp. Microsoft Office Package
  • Fluent spoken and written in Nepali and English
  • Documentation skills in English and Nepali is a must

District Accountant – 1- Dhanusha District

Basic Job Information

Employment Type: Full Time

Duty Station: Dhanusha District

Offered Salary: Negotiable

Overall Purpose of the Position:

The District Accountant shall be responsible for overall financial leadership and management of project at district level. S/he shall lead the planning, implementation, and monitoring of financial and procurement transaction of projects. S/he shall ensure all financial policy and donor compliances, quality assurance of project implementation and reporting.

Main Tasks and Responsibilities of the Position:

  • Provide administrative, financial, procurement and logistic support for the implementation of the district project in the collaboration of admin and finance Manager of FEDO central office.
  • Prepare and ensure accuracy and quality of financial report of project at district.
  • Collect timely financial documents, compile them, prepare monthly/quarterly financial reports and submit to FEDO central office within the deadline.
  • Prepare quarterly budget forecast for the project and timely submit the fund request to central office for the smooth operation of the project activities.
  • Develop and maintain relationship with local Partners, Banks, Vendors, Line agencies, Communities, project staff and other central office staffs and central and district committee members to facilitate good financial management processes.
  • Ensure all district Project staffs are fully oriented to requirements for financial documentation and settlement and carry out checks, including through field monitoring visits that the correct financial standards and procedures are followed across the organization
  • Manage assets register, carrying out physical verification of assets according to Financial and Administration Regulations and ensure accuracy of non-recurring items stock book.
  • Prepare and maintain personal file for each staff member and manage leave system and records.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Completed Bachelor’s degree in management with at least Two years working experience in financial and accounting management of non-profit organization or completed Intermediate degree in management with at least Five years working experience in financial and accounting management of non-profit organization.
  • The working experience in FAMAS Accounting Software will be added value.

Knowledge and skills needed:

  • Understanding of GoN rules and regulations, acts and policies regarding non-profit/social sector associations and good knowledge of non-profit sector financial management
  • Knowledge of budget preparation, financial reports, understanding of taxation rules
  • Sound Financial communication and interpersonal skill
  • Sound knowledge of Computer accounting software, office application software packages

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are requested to send their Updated CV (max 3 pages), and a cover letter (max 1 page) mentioning minimum salary expectation by 26 December 2025 via e-mail to dms.fedo@gmail.com. Please indicate the position that you are applying for in the subject line of your email.

Kaski and Dhanusha district’s Dalit, Women and Youth candidates are highly encouraged to apply. The priority will be given to the respective district-based candidates for the positions. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for written test and interview. Telephone enquiry will not be entertained. FEDO reserves to right to select and inform an appropriate candidate.

For further information about FEDO, please visit our website: www.fedonepal.org

Feminist Dalit Organization (FEDO)

Kupondole, Lalitpur, Nepal

Position: Technical Director
Location: Kathmandu

The Technical Director leads and directs technical focus areas across the Activity to enhance global health security in priority countries. This position will align STRIDES technical frameworks, approaches, tools, and activities with relevant normative guidelines and technical standards. This may include identifying specialized partnership needs and engaging qualified partners to ensure technical performance. STRIDES Nepal Technical Director works closely with technical leads, the Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning (MEL) Advisor and Director and Program Management Project Director to cascade the Activity’s technical approach and ensure adherence with the USG GHS priorities across country-level work plans. The Technical Director is accountable for the successful delivery of all technical aspects and reporting across STRIDES from initiation through delivery and closeout, ensuring completion of technical deliverables on schedule and within budget and that meet or exceed quality standards.

Key Responsibilities

  • Serves as STRIDES technical lead and key point of contact for relevant topics.
  • Provides technical direction to develop country-specific workplans and budgets, ensuring alignment with STRIDES objectives and USG priorities and with global technical standards.
  • Ensures high quality technical deliverables, including workplans, required and ad hoc reports, and success stories highlighting technical achievements are developed, submitted, and approved on schedule and within budget parameters.
  • Provides directions to ensure technical activities are compliant with STRIDES contract, government regulations, relevant quality standards, and FHI 360’s policies and procedures.
  • Responds to client requests and questions on technical matters; ensures timely drafts and submissions of consent, approvals, and/or waivers.
  • Ensures technical activities are designed to support STRIDES monitoring and evaluation activities; collaborates with the MEL Advisor and Project Director to finalize and submit country-specific technical indicators and report against their progress in quarterly, annual, and other reports.
  • Assesses subcontractors’ performance on technical activities and directs adjustments, as needed.
  • Collaborating with the MEL Advisor and Project Director and Communications leads to promoting STRIDES successes by collecting, writing, and distributing success stories, case studies, photos, and outreach at events.
  • Represent STRIDES at global health security-focused technical events; and technical working groups meeting; collect and share information that could be valuable to the Activity.
  • Work closely with the Ministry of Health and Population (MoHP), Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development (MoALD) and their relevant departments, divisions, and centers as well as technical working groups.
  • Supports performance management and professional development of direct reports, including ongoing feedback, coaching and career support.
  • Coordinates across Senior Management Team to set budgets, goals, and develop procedures and training for projects.
  • Leads and directs staff to achieve strategic project goals, ensuring alignment with USG priorities.
  • Perform other relevant duties as assigned by supervisors and Country Representative.

Requirements

  • Master’s degree or its international equivalent in public health or other relevant health-related fields with five to seven years of relevant experience; or a
  • Bachelor’s degree with eight years of experience in these areas.
  • Project Management certification preferred.
  • Prior experience implementing USG-funded contracts strongly preferred.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures with contract and project management and technical development.
  • Ability to exercise judgment within defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
  • Prior experience working with MoHP, MoALD, and their respective departments, divisions, and centers, as well as experience in an international non-governmental organization (INGO), is considered an advantage.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of concepts, practices, and policies related to global health security.
  • Proven ability to ensure that budgets, schedules, and performance requirements are met.
  • Proactive at managing multiple tasks, supervising others, and working in the virtual work environment, must be open to managing time for collaborating with teams in different time zones as needed.
  • Excellent interpersonal, Leadership, organizational, communication, project management, team building and management, and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent oral and written English and Nepali including documentation skills.

The final deadline for application is 5:00 p.m. December 28, 2025.

Position: STRIDES Nepal Project Director

Location: Kathmandu

The STRIDES Nepal Project Director leads and directs implementation of an anticipated Activity to enhance global health priorities in country with the general objectives to strengthen capacity across laboratory and surveillance systems to prevent, detect, and rapidly and effectively respond to emerging infectious diseases and other public health threats. The STRIDES Nepal Project Director will fulfill the diverse managerial requirements of the Activity and have technical and management responsibility for all activities, personnel, and budget/spending. The STRIDES Nepal Project Director serves as the Activity’s primary liaison with posts in country, local government, and other global health security implementing partners working in country in addition to overseeing STRIDES subcontractors operating in country. The STRIDES Nepal Project Director, will lead the development and implementation of annual work plans, monitoring and evaluation activities, technical and financial reporting, and other administrative elements of the Activity.

Key responsibilities

  • Plans, directs, and coordinates implementation of Activity to ensure that goals and objectives are accomplished within prescribed period and funding parameters.
  • Establishes work plans, teams, and standard operating procedures (SOPs) to meet Activity goals and ensure compliance with policies.
  • Directly manages technical, financial, and operational staff responsible for all aspects of the GHS Activity.
  • Responsible for creating, promoting, and maintaining safe and equitable work environments for all personnel, including a harassment- and violence-free work culture, and systems for safeguarding Activity participants.
  • Manages in-country relationships with national, regional, and local government counterparts and multisectoral partners to fulfill national global health security objectives and targets and operationalize implementing activities.
  • Serve as the primary point of contact and collaboration for the team and in-country partners, including Department of State, implementation partners, government partners, and other key partners.
  • Leads in-country team and liaises with Activity leadership at the global level to define, develop, implement, monitor, and adjust technical work plans, budgets, presentations, and reports.
  • Ensures on-time delivery of high-quality deliverables and reports.
  • Provides guidance and training to managers and staff to achieve Activity goals.
  • Responsible for onboarding of Activity staff, ensuring their familiarity with organizational and Activity values, quality standards, policies and procedures and their individual responsibilities in upholding them.
  • Work closely with the Ministry of Health and Population (MoHP), Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development (MoALD) and their relevant departments, divisions and centers.
  • Supports performance management and professional development of direct reports, including ongoing feedback, coaching, and career support.
  • Sets goals and budgets and leads in-country teams to achieve strategic goals.
  • Leads coordination of resources for Activity implementation addresses/resolves Activity issues.
  • Serves as a member of Nepal Country Office Senior Leadership Team and provide input and assistance to the country office and program management and operations as well as business development activities.
  • Perform other relevant duties as assigned by supervisors and Country Representative.

Requirements

  • Master’s degree or its international equivalent in public health or other relevant health-related fields, with seven or more years of experience, including at least five years of staff management and substantial experience in project management principles and practices or bachelor’s degree with ten years of experience in relevant field mentioned above.
  • Project management certification preferred.
    Demonstrated knowledge and experience working on the management and implementation of human or animal health projects and interventions for infectious diseases.
  • Knowledge and experience working on GHS projects or activities preferred; experience working across multiple sectors (One Health) desirable.
  • Demonstrated experience in developing and mentoring staff, building the capacity of local teams and partners, and managing complex, multidisciplinary projects, and activities.
  • Experience working with MoHP, MoALD and their respective departments, divisions and centers is desirable.
  • Proficient with applicable Department of State or other donor rules, regulations, and policies, with comprehensive knowledge of project management theories, concepts, and practices, as well as process development and execution. Familiarity with international Global Health Security frameworks and initiatives, particularly those related to Department of State programs and priorities is highly preferred.
  • Demonstrated skills in project management, including the ability to lead the development of annual work plans and deliverables, while overseeing the Activity’s monitoring and evaluation plan to ensure achievement of goals and objectives.
  • Prior experience developing partnerships and managing relationships with State, host country government, key partners, and other implementing partners in country is highly preferred.
  • Proven leadership in managing staff within a matrixed organization, with prior experience in an international non-governmental organization (INGO) considered an advantage.
  • This role requires flexibility for domestic travel, up to 25% of the time.
  • Able to manage multiple priorities effectively, supervise teams, and thrive in a virtual work environment.
  • Must be flexible in coordinating with teams across different time zones.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, negotiation, communication, collaboration, team building and management, and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent oral and written English and Nepali including documentation skills.

The final deadline for application is 5:00 p.m. December 28, 2025.

Project: SLUMS TO STADIUM: Equalizing the Playing Field for Marginalized Youths through Football in Urban Slums of Nepal (Project S2S)Implementing Organizationfor KaskiDistrict: United CommunityNepal(UniCoN)

Funding: Child Nepal/European Union Delegation to Nepal

UniCoN, in partnership with the Child Nepal/European Union Delegation to Nepal, is implementing the “Slums to Stadium (S2S)

” project under Lot 3 –Youths and Sportsas a co-applicant for Bara district. The project aims to empower marginalized youth from slum communities through football coaching, sports-based entrepreneurship, and strong safeguarding systems in and Bara districts.

UniCoNinvites applications from qualified, committed, and motivated Nepali citizens for the following full-time positions:

1.Program Officer-1(Full Time)

Duty Station: Kaski, Pokhara(with frequent field visits)

Duration:1 January 2026-31 December 2026 (with possibility of extension)

Reports to: Project Manager Key Responsibilities

  • Support day-to-day implementation of project activities in line with approved work plans
  • Coordinate with lead-applicants (Child Nepal) for project implementation
  • Support organization of football coaching programs, youth events, and trainings
  • Monitor activity implementation and ensure timely reporting from field level
  • Assist in preparation of narrative reports for lead-applicant and internal reporting
  • Ensure integration of safeguarding, gender equality, and inclusion in all activities
  • Maintain project documentation, attendance records, and activity reports
  • Participate in monitoring visits and stakeholder coordination meetings
  • Perform any other duties assigned by the Project Manager

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences, Development Studies, Sports Management, or a related field
  • Minimum 3–5 years of experience in project implementation with NGOs/INGOs
  • Experience working on youth, sports, child protection, or community development projects preferred
  • Familiarity with EU-funded or donor-funded project implementation is an asset▪
  • Strong organizational, communication, and reporting skills▪
  • Willingness to travel regularly to project districts▪
  • Fluency in Nepali and working knowledge of English

2. Finance Officer -1, (Full Time)

Duty Station: Kaski, Pokhara

Duration:1 January 2026-31 December 2026(with possibility of extension)

Reports to: Program Officer

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage project financial transactions in compliance with EU rules
  • Prepare financial reports, budgets, and forecasts
  • Ensure proper documentation and archiving of financial records
  • Support audits, verifications, and financial reviews
  • Monitor partner expenditures and provide financial guidance
  • Ensure compliance with Child Nepal and EU financial policies

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field▪
  • Minimum 3years of experience in NGO/INGO financial management
  • Strong experience with EU-funded project financial rules
  • Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel
  • Strong attention to detail and integrity

3. Facilitator-1,(FullTime)

Duty Station: Kaski, Pokhara

Duration:1 January 2026-31 December 2026(with possibility of extension)

Reports to: Program Officer/ Football Coach Key Responsibilities:

  • Mobilize youths from slum communities to participate in project activities
  • Support football coaching sessions and youth entrepreneurship initiatives
  • Facilitate community meetings, awareness sessions, and safeguarding activities
  • Coordinate with local stakeholders, schools, and community leaders
  • Collect basic monitoring data and success stories
  • Promote inclusion, gender equality, and child safeguarding

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Intermediate level (10+2) education or Bachelor’s degree(preferred)and relevant experience in social work, community development, or sports
  • Minimum 2–3 years of experience working with marginalized communities
  • Experience in youth engagement or sports programs preferred
  • Strong interpersonal and facilitation skills

Application Procedure

  • Interested candidates are requested to submit following credentials in the given email: vacancy@unitedcommunitynepal.org
  • A cover letter (clearly mentioning the position applied for)
  • An updated CV
  • Deadline:23December 2025
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Position: HR and Admin Manager

Location: Biratnagar, Kathmandu

Division: Human Resource

Type: FULLTIME

Position Overview

The HR & Administration Manager will be responsible for overseeing end-to-end human resource functions along with comprehensive administrative operations at the factory. The role requires a strong balance between people management and operational efficiency, ensuring a compliant, safe, and productive working environment while supporting management and employees in achieving organizational objectives.

Roles and Responsibilities

Key Roles & Responsibilities Human Resources Management

  • Manage the complete recruitment lifecycle including manpower planning, job postings, screening, interviewing, selection, and issuance of offer letters.
  • Oversee onboarding and orientation programs to ensure smooth integration of new employees into the organization.
  • Act as a key point of contact between management and employees to address concerns, resolve conflicts, handle grievances, and foster a positive workplace culture.
  • Support employee engagement initiatives, disciplinary processes, and performance-related coordination in line with company policies.
  • Ensure compliance with labor laws, factory regulations, and internal HR policies.

Administrative & Facility Management

  • Oversee day-to-day administrative operations to ensure uninterrupted factory functioning, including office supplies, infrastructure upkeep, and general maintenance.
  • Manage factory administration covering housekeeping, security services, canteen operations, transportation, and employee accommodation.
  • Ensure a safe, healthy, and efficient working environment by implementing health, safety, and workplace compliance standards.
  • Coordinate regular inspections, safety audits, and corrective actions in line with statutory requirements.

Vendor & Service Provider Management

  • Manage and negotiate contracts with vendors and service providers for administrative services, facility management, and procurements.
  • Ensure cost-effective procurement while maintaining service quality and compliance with company standards.
  • Monitor vendor performance, resolve service issues, and ensure timely payments and renewals.

Records & Documentation

  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of employee documents, contracts, agreements, licenses, and statutory compliances.
  • Ensure proper filing, confidentiality, and audit-readiness of all HR and administrative documentation.

Cross-functional Coordination

  • Coordinate closely with IT, Maintenance, Utilities, and other support teams to ensure smooth operational support for factory activities.
  • Act as a liaison between factory operations and corporate/shared service teams to align HR and administrative processes.

Qualifications

Key Skills & Competencies

  • 8+ years of experience in HR practices, labor laws, and factory administration
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and conflict-resolution skills
  • Proven ability to manage vendors and multiple administrative functions

Required Skills

  • High level of organizational and documentation skills
  • Ability to work independently in a factory environment and manage operational challenges

Rural Women Upliftment Association (RWUA), Haripur-02, Sarlaahi is a non-political, non-profit organization established 33 years ago on Kartik 22, 2050 B.S., with the vision of uplifting marginalized and rural women and communities. Since its inception, RWUA has been working in key areas including women’s empowerment, gender equality, social inclusion, education, health, livelihoods, child protection, Advocacy/lobbying, and transparent local governance, with a strong focus on Dalits, indigenous groups, persons with disabilities, and other marginalized populations. Through community-centered approaches, RWUA has supported capacity development, poverty reduction, counselling on foreign employment, assistance to vulnerable families, and overall empowerment. Currently, in partnership with Save the Children, RWUA is implementing the Samunnati Project in Ishworpur and Haripur Municipalities, focusing on education, health, livelihoods, child protection, and advocacy, policy, and lobby, while continuing its recognized role as a leading gender / Child protection resource center at district and regional levels.

RWUA, in partnership with Save the Children, has been funded, Implementing the Sponsorship (SAMUNNATI) Project in Sarlahi District since 2017 in Ishworpur and Haripur Municipalities, focusing on education, health, livelihoods, child protection, and advocacy, policy, and lobby, while continuing its recognized role as a leading gender / Child protection resource centre at district and regional levels.

RWUA now invites applications from interested and qualified Nepali citizens for the following positions:

TITLE OF POSITION: Field Coordinator-Education

No. Required: 1

GRADE/LEVEL: Coordinator

LOCATION OF THE POSITION: RWUA Working Area ( Haripur 02 Sarlahi)

IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR/REPORTING TO: Program Manager

POSITION TO BE SUPERVISED: Field Officer

WORKING AREA: Haripur and Ishworpur Municipality, Sarlahi

CHILD SAFEGUARDING:

The position holder will frequently have direct contact with children and/or young people in their day-to-day work. S/he will have to abide by the child safeguarding, protection from sexual exploitation, abuse, and harassment (PSEAH) policy, including the RWUA code of conduct. S/he will have to maintain dual adult rules while visiting/meeting with children.

ROLE PURPOSE:

The Field Coordinator – Education is responsible for executing a range of activities within the education sector, focusing on Early Childhood Care and Development (ECCD) and Basic Education. The role encompasses strategic project planning, implementation, monitoring, reporting, and effective collaboration with local government (LG) counterparts and stakeholders to ensure project deliverables are met.

The incumbent supervises and mentors Field Officers, facilitates research, documents lessons learned, and promotes best practices. The position is accountable for managing field-level education activities, ensuring quality implementation, and preparing comprehensive reports.

This role allocates approximately 70% of time to field-level operations and coordination and 30% to reporting and higher-level collaboration.

The Field Coordinator is also responsible for upholding organizational priorities, including safeguarding, zero-tolerance policies, and safety/security measures.

ROLE PURPOSE:

The position holder will have overall responsibilities of program management-planning, project tracking, implementation, monitoring/supervision, technical backstopping, data/information management, and reporting of sponsorship program under education theme. S/he will also be responsible for coaching, mentoring, capacity building to the teachers, school management, ECCD, children, parents, and education stakeholders around education; and will also provide guidance and supervision support in community mobilization, teachers and community volunteers who facilitate educational interventions in communities and schools.

The position holder will have responsibilities of assessments, research, survey, generate lesson learned, document best practices, and success stories from field and share with project/program team, donor agency and stakeholders. S/he will also be responsible for supporting to Field Coordinator and field officers during need and requirements of program that best fit for the best interest of children.

Position: Communication Manager
Department: Communication
Reports to: Country Director
Location: Kathmandu (with 20% travel to working districts)
Work Hours: Full-time; 40 hours per week

ROLE SUMMARY:

Communication Manager will lead UWS Nepal’s communication strategy, playing a critical role in shaping the organization’s public image, brand identity, and stakeholder engagement. This role involves developing and executing strategic communication plans, managing a small communications team, and collaborating closely with senior leadership to ensure consistent and impactful messaging across all channels. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a creative approach to storytelling, capable of building strong relationships with the media, donors, and partners, while effectively managing digital platforms and content creation.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Strategic Leadership:

  • Develop and implement a comprehensive communications strategy that aligns with UWS Nepal’s mission and growth plans.
  • Oversee the development and execution of internal and external communication policies to enhance UWS Nepal’s brand visibility and influence.
  • Lead the development of an in-country marketing & communications annual plan that incorporates at least two goals from the global marcomms plan.

Content Development and Management:

  • Oversee the creation of high-impact content for digital platforms, including websites, social media, newsletters, press releases, annual reports, and multimedia materials.
  • Ensure consistent and compelling storytelling that captures the impact of UWS Nepal’s work in marginalized communities.
  • Guide the production of case studies, impact stories, and videos that effectively communicate the organization’s achievements.
  • Review and ensure the in-country content calendar is strategically aligned with clear target audiences.
  • Move and manage the content calendar on monday.com to enable cross-team collaboration.

Media and Stakeholder Relations:

  • Cultivate and manage strong relationships with media outlets, journalists, influencers, and key stakeholders.
  • Serve as the primary media spokesperson, ensuring accurate and positive coverage of UWS Nepal’s initiatives.
  • Plan and execute press conferences, stakeholder meetings, and high-profile events to increase UWS Nepal’s visibility.

Digital Strategy and Brand Management:

  • Manage all UWS Nepal digital channels, including social media platforms, website, and digital archives.
  • Develop monthly communication plans with clear KPIs to measure the impact of digital outreach.
  • Ensure brand consistency across all communication channels and marketing materials.

Team Management and Capacity Building:

  • Lead, mentor, and support the communications team, fostering a culture of creativity and collaboration.
  • Provide training and guidance to staff on effective communication practices and brand alignment.
  • Participate actively in the communications working group, including attendance and contribution to discussions and initiatives.
  • Support and engage in report-writing training through the communications working group, with follow-up support from global comms.

Monitoring and Reporting:

  • Track and report on the effectiveness of communication efforts, using data to refine strategies and improve outreach.
  • Regularly update senior management and the board on communication milestones and media coverage.
  • Conduct a target audience review to identify who UWS Nepal is currently reaching and who the organization needs to prioritize.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Support the Country Director and senior leadership in strategic planning and organizational growth initiatives.
  • Perform additional duties as required to strengthen UWS Nepal’s communications function.

Safeguarding and Child Protection:

  • Uphold UWS Nepal’s commitment to child protection and safeguarding by ensuring all communications reflect the organization’s values and ethical standards.
  • Ensure that all digital and print materials, including images and case studies, protect the rights and dignity of children and vulnerable groups.

How to Apply?

To apply for this position, please send a comprehensive CV (maximum of two pages), and cover letter to info.nepal@uwsglobal.net. The deadline for applications is 5:00 p.m. on December 25, 2025.

UWS Nepal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are only able to accept applications from candidates who have the permanent right to employment in Nepal.

UWS Nepal is committed to the safeguarding of children, and ensuring we recruit safely is central to this commitment. All applicants will be required to undertake a DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check as a condition of employment.

National Campaign for Education Nepal (NCE Nepal) is a national network comprising 508 organizations, including I/NGOs, teacher associations, media networks, and community-based groups, all dedicated to promoting the right to education and lifelong learning for children and adults in Nepal. NCE Nepal primarily engages in advocacy, lobbying, campaigning and evidence-based research to inform education policies and programs. For over two decades, it has championed good governance and education advocacy through the collective efforts of civil society organizations (CSOs).

With support from the European Union (EU), NCE Nepal is working in partnership with Global Action Nepal (GAN) and the Nepal Disabled Women Association (NDWA) to implement the Civil Society Participation in Education (COPE) project. This initiative seeks to strengthen the public education system and enhance access to free, inclusive and equitable quality education especially in Madesh and Karnali Provinces through active and meaningful civil society participation.

NCE Nepal is seeking qualified, motivated and dedicated candidates for the position of Program Coordinator.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Design, plan and implement programs and events and ensure proper documentation of the programs and events organized
  • Support members in conducting advocacy, campaigning and partnership development at the different levels.
  • Ensure quality monitoring of activities implemented by its members and partners.
  • Coordinate with Project Partners, members and networks for enhancing the partnership
  • Document lesson learnt, best practices and success stories of the advocacy & campaign
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly, semi -annual and annual project report as per the requirement of the project.

Qualification, Skills and Knowledge:

  • Master’s in education or others subjects as equivalent with 3 years of experience or Bachelor in Education or other subject as equivalent with 5 years of experience
  • Demonstrated technical skills in writing, data analysis and research
  • Sound knowledge on human rights to education child rights and issues of SDG4
  • Good skills on networking, coordination, communication, management, advocacy and campaigning
  • Good interpersonal skills to deal with the colleagues in the organization and capability and willingness to work under the pressures and multiple deadlines

Person with disability, female, indigenous group and marginalized communities will be given preference. The interested and qualified applicants are requested to send application along with a motivation letter and recent CV with two references (Current and immediate past line managers mandatorily) via email: ncehumanresource@gmail.com by or before December 25, 2025.

*Only shortlisted candidates will be invited in written test and interview. Telephone inquiries will not be entertained. NCE Nepal reserves the right to reject any or all applications.

Caritas Nepal (CN) is a non-profit organization solely devoted to the service of the poor, most disadvantaged, and marginalized people irrespective of caste, creed, ethnicity, and nationality. With the vision of creating peaceful, equitable and just society, where there is solidarity among people and respect for human dignity, Caritas Nepal works on the sectors of social justice and community development, disaster risk management, sustainable livelihoods, migrants, refugee and anti-trafficking, emergency and recovery supports as well as advocacy on social concerns.

CN invites eligible applications from qualified Nepali citizens for the following position under the Food Security and Resilient Project (FSRP) -Khatyad, Mugu. The project aims to increase food security and climate resilience of more than 600 smallholder farmers in ward 3, 5 and 6 of Khatyad Rural Municipality in Mugu district.

Job Code: ATA

Designation: Agriculture Technical Assistant-1

Location: Caritas Nepal, Field office Mugu

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Minimum qualification: Junior Technical Assistant (JTA) in Agriculture with at least 3 years of relevant experience or a Diploma in Agriculture (3 years course) with at least 1 year of experience in relevant field. Preference will be given to the candidates with Bsc in Agriculture will be given preference.
  • Familiarity with local farming systems, climate-resilient agricultural practices, and the local language/culture should be considered an added advantage.
  • Practical experience in kitchen gardens, nursery management, IPM, and integrated farming systems and community seed bank.
  • Prior experience working with smallholder farmers and community-based organizations particularly in remote or hilly areas, is preferred.
  • Ability to work closely with communities, local governments, and diverse stakeholders.
  • Strong communication and facilitation skills with community groups.
  • Experience in documentation, reporting, and field-level data collection.
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Power point) preferred.
  • Ability and willingness to travel frequently to remote and rural project sites.

Other competencies:

  • Strong community engagement and participatory facilitation skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and coordination abilities.
  • Commitment to gender equality, social inclusion, and child rights.
  • Analytical and problem-solving mindset.
  • Flexibility and adaptability to diverse field conditions.
  • Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time efficiently in a dynamic and challenging environment.

Additional Requirement:

  • A valid motorcycle license and driving skills are preferred.
  • Applicants from marginalized and disadvantaged communities, women, and local residents are strongly encouraged to apply.

Job Description

Click the given link for the full job description: https://tinyurl.com/AssistAt

How to apply:

You are required to fill out the job application form. Please click the link below. (Mandatory) https://forms.office.com/r/jbwNPHe8RY

You are required to rename your CV as Job Code_First Name_LastName. Email subject should contain the applied designation; otherwise, it will not be accepted.

Interested applicants meeting the criteria are requested to send the documents (application letter, updated CV with references, and a recent photograph) to vacancy@caritas.org.np or physically drop them off at the CN field or Provincial Office no later than 17:00 hours on Thursday, January 1, 2026. Applications received after this deadline will not be considered.

Please note: This is a field-based position and involves extensive travel to villages/rural areas where living conditions are minimal. Only those willing to travel and committed to serving the communities in rural settings need apply. Caritas is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women/members of marginalized communities/disadvantaged groups to apply.

Caritas Nepal promotes its principles, strategies, policies, and procedures on Safeguarding (including Child Safeguarding and Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse) and Safety & Security, and all applicants must adhere to Caritas Nepal’s key policies and procedures.

Position: Officer – Bank and Corporate Relations

Location: Pulchowk, Lalitpur District, Nepal

Seats: 1

Job Level: Entry Level

Job Type: Full Time

Category: Bank and Corporate

Application Deadline: 2026-01-31

The Officer – Bank & Corporate Relations will be responsible for managing day-to-day coordination with partner banks and BFIs, monitoring transaction performance, supporting joint promotional campaigns, ensuring contractual and documentation compliance, and assisting in periodic reporting. The role plays a key part in strengthening eSewa’s banking partnerships and ensuring smooth operational and financial communication.

Qualification and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Banking, Management, or a related field
  • Prior experience in banking, fintech, corporate relations, or partnerships is preferred
  • Knowledge of digital wallets or payment systems is an added advantage

Job Description

1. Transaction Monitoring & Reporting

  • Maintain daily records of transaction counts related to Load, Withdraw, and P2P transactions.
  • Monitor transaction trends and identify any unusual surge or decline, escalating insights to relevant stakeholders.
  • Assist in the preparation of monthly transaction and performance reports for internal and external use.

2. Bank & BFI Coordination

  • Communicate regularly with partner banks and BFIs regarding operational and settlement-related matters.
  • Send monthly commission settlement emails to BFIs within the first week of each month.
  • Respond to bank queries and provide detailed transaction or commission breakdowns as requested.
  • Maintain professional and timely communication to strengthen banking relationships.

3. Marketing & Promotion Coordination

  • Coordinate with the Digital Marketing team for the creation of:
  • Promotional banners
  • Campaign messaging
  • FCM (Firebase Cloud Messaging) notifications
  • Collaborate with banks on joint promotional campaigns, ensuring alignment with partner expectations and timelines.

4. Proposal, Contract & Compliance Management

  • Prepare and support proposals for bank and corporate partnerships.
  • Assist in managing contracts, agreements, and MoUs with banks and corporate partners.
  • Ensure 100% compliance with data documentation, record-keeping, and internal governance requirements.
  • Maintain organized documentation for audits and regulatory reviews.

Required Skills

  • Strong communication and coordination skills
  • Basic understanding of digital payments, banking operations, and fintech ecosystems
  • Data handling and reporting skills (Excel, Google Sheets, dashboards)
  • Attention to detail and documentation accuracy
  • Ability to work cross-functionally with marketing, finance, and technical teams

Benefits of Working at eSewa

  •  Stellar opportunity to work with the rising company
  •  The amazing and passionate young team, beautiful office space
  •  Trust of biggest FinTech company.
  •  One-of-a-kind company culture and growth opportunities to accelerate your career progression.

How to apply?

We are always keen to meet energetic and talented professionals who would like to join our team. Click on the button below and submit your application to apply for the post.

Position: Business Development Officer – Hospitality
Location: Chitwan
Seats: 1
Job Level: Mid Level
Job Type: Full Time
Category: Business Development
Application Deadline: 2026-01-31

The Business Development Officer – Hospitality will be responsible for onboarding hotel partners, managing partner relationships, ensuring inventory and content accuracy, and driving booking performance through effective coordination, quality control, and data-driven execution. The role plays a key part in strengthening hospitality partnerships and optimizing hotel visibility and sales on the platform.

Qualification and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Marketing, or a related field
  • 2-3 years of experience in hospitality, partnerships, or business development

Job Description

1. Hotel Onboarding & Quality Assurance

  • Identify, approach, and onboard new hotel partners as per business targets.
  • Ensure accurate and complete uploading of hotel details including rates, amenities, policies, and images.
  • Follow standardized onboarding checklists to maintain compliance and quality standards.
  • Monitor and reduce onboarding and content-related errors through regular reviews.
  • Coordinate with internal teams to resolve onboarding or system-related issues.

2. Partner Relationship Management

  • Maintain regular communication with hotel partners through calls, meetings, and field visits.
  • Conduct monthly partner engagement and performance review discussions.
  • Address partner queries, concerns, and operational issues within defined TAT.
  • Work towards improving partner satisfaction and retaining top-performing hotels.
  • Build long-term partnerships to support mutual growth and revenue objectives.

3. Inventory, Pricing & Content Management

  • Ensure timely updates of hotel inventory, room availability, and blackout dates.
  • Monitor rate accuracy and coordinate with partners to maintain competitive pricing.
  • Review and enhance hotel content quality including images, amenities, and descriptions.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to improve hotel visibility and booking conversion.
  • Track booking performance and identify opportunities for growth.

4. Data Reporting, Analysis & Weekly Performance Review

  • Prepare and submit weekly and monthly performance reports related to hotel onboarding and bookings.
  • Analyze performance data, identify trends, and highlight variances.
  • Share conversion insights and recommendations with relevant stakeholders.
  • Propose and support process improvements based on data findings.
  • Ensure data accuracy and timely reporting for informed decision-making.

Required Skills

  • Strong business development and negotiation skills
  • Excellent communication and relationship management abilities
  • Understanding of hospitality operations and online booking platforms
  • Data handling and reporting skills
  • Ability to work cross-functionally with internal teams
  • Field-oriented mindset with problem-solving capability

Benefits of Working at eSewa

  • Opportunity to grow with eSewa, Nepal’s leading and fastest-growing FinTech company
  • Collaborative, energetic, and passionate team culture supported by a modern and inspiring work environment
  • Backed by the trust and credibility of Nepal’s largest digital payments ecosystem
  • A unique company culture with continuous learning and career growth opportunities to accelerate your professional journey

How to apply?

We are always keen to meet energetic and talented professionals who would like to join our team. Click on the button below and submit your application to apply for the post.
