content.rendered:
Position: Senior Assistant – Data System
Job ID: HQ01862
Location: Nepal
Closing Date: 19-Dec-2025

About IRRI

The International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) is dedicated to reducing poverty and hunger through rice science; improving the health and welfare of rice farmers and consumers; and protecting the rice-growing environment for future generations. IRRI is an independent, nonprofit, research and educational institute, founded in 1960 by the Ford and Rockefeller foundations with support from the Philippine government. The institute, headquartered in Los Baños, Philippines, has offices in 17 rice-growing countries in Asia and Africa, and over 1,000 staff.

Working with in-country partners, IRRI develops advanced rice varieties that yield more grain and better withstand pests and disease as well as flooding, drought, and other harmful effects of climate change.

Job Purpose
The International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI), on behalf of the International Rice Research Institute in Nepal seeks to hire one Senior Assistant – Data Systems. ILRI works to improve food and nutritional security and reduce poverty in developing countries through research for efficient, safe and sustainable use of livestock. It is the only one of 15 CGIAR research centres dedicated entirely to animal agriculture research for the developing world. Co-hosted by Kenya and Ethiopia, it has regional or country offices and projects in East, South and Southeast Asia as well as Central, East, Southern and West Africa. (www.ilri.org)

The position is linked to the Asia Africa Dairy Genetic Gain Project (AADGG) Country Program and focuses on ICT and Data Management in Livestock Production and productivity in Nepal. Current and emerging Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and genomic tools as implemented by the Africa Dairy Genetic Gains (ADGG) program present new opportunities to hasten genetic gains in dairy productivity in Nepal. The data system assistant will help develop, domesticate and scale information and communication technology (ICT) tools to capture herd, cow level and other related data from small, medium and large scale farms, and integrate these into national herd performance recording and evaluation systems.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Contribute to the development, enhancement, and management of livestock production, productivity, and genetic data systems — including data collation, processing, and secure storage — for effective use within the ADGG Country Program.
  • Review and analyze existing data capture tools, and support the design and development of extended modules to improve their functionality and scope.
  • Provide timely ICT support to farmers and field-based partner agents through various communication channels such as WhatsApp, Telegram, telephone, and field visits.
  • Deliver technical support and troubleshooting for users of the AADGG web-based platform and mobile application.
  • Implement, monitor, and ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across all data collection and management activities.
  • Organize and deliver operational training sessions and capacity-building programs for key stakeholders and end users to enhance system adoption and effective utilization.
  • The data system assistant will engage with stakeholders in the livestock sector including the national actors involved in animal breeding.
  • Engage with scientists and experts in academic institutions and national research institutions such as NARC and build effective partnerships.
  • Communicate and connect with all relevant actors through participation in working group meetings, seminars and outreach workshops. The person will also communicate through communication products.
  • Providing operational support regularly to the AADGG user in Nepal.
  • Conduct capacity building training to the key stakeholders.
  • Work to establish national level of AADGG platform.
  • Data review, reporting as required. Convey information, deliver presentations and seek collaboration to develop community oriented breeding programs.

Qualifications

  • BA/BSc degree in Information Systems, Database Management, Computer Science or related discipline with at least 1 year of relevant work experience preferably in ICT/data management for research/agriculture.

Skills Required

Mandatory:

  • Experience working with integrated database systems, preferably for research projects, including large-scale socioeconomic and/or biological surveys e.g., MySQL, MS SQL Server or Oracle.
  • Advanced experience of SQL language for data extraction and management of databases.
  • Knowledge and experience of Linux operative system.

Language – English & Nepali

Preferred:

  • Experience in software programming
  • Understanding and experience of working in applied agricultural research preferred.
  • Experience working with farmers/field agents
  • Excellent interpersonal communication and good personal organization skills.
  • Good communication ability in English, spoken and written.
  • Good judgment and willingness to take initiative when appropriate.

IRRI offers a highly extensive employee benefits package inclusive of globally covered medical insurance, retirement plan, life and accident insurance and other allowances.

Join our team and be part of our story!

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

This position will remain open until filled.

title.rendered: Project Accountant, Finance and Admin Officer

content.rendered:
Samriddha Pahad (www.spnepal.org) is a development-focused organization committed to improving the livelihoods of rural and remote communities in Nepal. It focuses on financial inclusion, enterprise promotion, and community empowerment. The organization works with local institutions and communities to expand economic opportunities and improve livelihoods.

Samriddha Pahad invites applications from qualified individuals for the following opportunities. These positions are part of an EU-funded project scheduled to begin in March 2026 and conclude in February 2029. The project aims to empower youth, strengthen local cultural and economic systems, and expand livelihood opportunities through capacity-building, innovation support, and community-led development initiatives. The project will be implemented in Taplejung District.

 Position: Project Accountant (Kathmandu Based)

Organization: Samriddha Pahad

Reports to: Sr. Finance & Administration Manager (Sr. FAM) / CEO

Duty Station: Kathmandu

1.1 Purpose of the Position

The Project Accountant is responsible for managing project-related financial transactions, ensuring timely reporting, maintaining compliance with organizational and donor requirements, and supporting overall financial management.

Key Responsibilities

Financial Management & Record Keeping

  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for all project activities.
  • Ensure proper documentation of all expenditures in compliance with financial policies.
  • Prepare vouchers, maintain ledgers, and update accounting software regularly.
  • Ensure proper application of Nepalese Tax laws in all financial transactions.

Budgeting & Financial Reporting

  • Assist in preparing project budgets and forecasting.
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports as required.
  • Support the Sr. FAM/CEO in donor financial reporting.

Compliance & Audit Support

  • Ensure adherence to financial policies, donor guidelines, and audit requirements.
  • Prepare and compile financial documents for internal and external audits.
  • Monitor expenses to ensure compliance with approved budgets.

Cash & Bank Management

  • Manage petty cash and bank transactions for the project.
  • Reconcile bank statements monthly.
  • Coordinate with banks for cheque handling, transfers, and other transactions.

Procurement & Administration Support

  • Support procurement processes following organizational guidelines.
  • Review bills, invoices, and supporting documents for payments.
  • Coordinate with admin/logistics for financial documentation.

Other Tasks

  • Support the Finance & Admin team in cross-cutting tasks.
  • Perform any other duties assigned by the Sr. FAM/CEO.

1.5 Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
  • Minimum 3–5 years of relevant professional experience in accounting or financial management.
  • Experience working with NGOs/INGOs is highly preferred.
  • Strong skills in MS Excel and proficiency in Tally accounting software.
  • Good communication skills in both English and Nepali.
  • Must possess a two‑wheeler with a valid driving license.
  • Experience working with development projects is an advantage.

1.6 Contract & Salary

Contract Duration: 3 years

Salary: A competitive remuneration package will be offered as per organizational policy.

Position: Finance & Admin Officer (Field Based – Taplejung)

Organization: Samriddha Pahad

Reports to: Project Manager / Sr. FAM

Duty Station: Taplejung

 Purpose of the Position

The Finance & Admin Officer is responsible for day-to-day financial operations, administrative support, logistics, and coordination at the field level. The role ensures proper financial management and smooth office functioning.

Key Responsibilities

Financial Operations

  • Manage daily financial transactions, including payments, receipts, and petty cash.
  • Maintain proper documentation and filing of all financial records at the field office.
  • Prepare and submit field-level monthly expenditure reports to the central office.
  • Ensure accurate application and compliance with Nepalese Tax laws in all financial transactions.
  • Prepare and submit field-level monthly expenditure reports to the central office.

Budget Monitoring & Reporting

  • Support the Project Manager in monitoring project expenditures.
  • Ensure expenses are aligned with approved budgets and financial policies.
  • Assist in forecasting field-level financial needs.

Administrative Management

  • Oversee field office administration, including logistics, asset management, and office supplies.
  • Maintain inventory records and ensure proper utilization of assets.
  • Manage staff attendance records and field office HR-related administrative tasks.

Procurement & Logistics

  • Support procurement of goods and services at the field level following guidelines.
  • Coordinate travel, accommodation, and logistics for staff and visitors.
  • Ensure proper documentation of procurement processes.

Coordination & Communication

  • Coordinate with the central Finance & Admin team on financial and administrative matters.
  • Facilitate communication between field staff and central office for operational needs.
  • Support the Project Manager in organizing field activities, meetings, and events.

Compliance & Audit Support

  • Ensure all financial and administrative practices comply with organizational rules.
  • Support project audits by preparing and submitting required documents.

Other Duties

  • Perform any other tasks assigned by the Project Manager or Sr. FAM.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • Minimum 3–5 years of experience in finance, administration, or field-level project support.
  • Experience working with NGOs/INGOs is highly preferred.
  • Strong skills in MS Excel and proficiency in Tally accounting software.
  • Good communication skills in both English and Nepali.
  • Must possess a two‑wheeler with a valid driving license.
  • Experience in rural or remote field settings is an added advantage.

    Contract & Salary

Contract Duration: 3 years

Salary: A competitive remuneration package will be offered as per organizational policy.

Interested Nepalese candidates are requested to submit their application along with updated CV to info@spnepal.org

Please clearly mention the position you are applying for in the email subject line; Applications without a specified position will not be processed.

Applications must be submitted by 26th December 2025.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for a written test and interview.

Voice of Children (VOC), established in 2000, is a non-governmental organization dedicated to protecting and advocating for the rights of children separated from their families, including street-connected, sexually abused, and other at-risk children. VOC implements preventive initiatives against child sexual abuse, with particular attention to sexual violence against boys and other child rights violations. In addition, VOC builds the capacity of vulnerable families and works in collaboration with child protection stakeholders to reinforce local child protection mechanisms.

VOC is implementing a project, “Stopping cybercrime against children: More safety and protection on the Internet,” with the support of KNH and BMZ Germany. The project invites applications from qualified, dynamic, and result-oriented Nepali citizens to fill the following position based in Sunsari district.

Position: Project Officer -1 (Based in Ithari, Sunsari)

Main Responsibilities:

  • Manage and facilitate trainings, workshops, and orientations on Child Online Protection for child protection Actors and service providers.
  • Implement activities such as e-learning on child protection and awareness campaigns on Child Online Protection.
  • Support for formation and strengthen of local-level Child Rights Committees at the municipal and ward levels.
  • Coordinate with service providers for the case management of children.
  • Prepare activity plans and budgets, and implement them in coordination with like-minded organizations.
  • Document and report project results and outcomes.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Social Work, Sociology, Development Studies, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 5 years of work experience with children, particularly in online child protection.
  • Strong facilitation skills and the ability to engage effectively with child protection stakeholders.
  • Proficient in computer applications, including Nepali typing.
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills in both English and Nepali.
  • Good knowledge of laws and policies related to child rights and protection.
  • Ability to work effectively in teams, flexible to work at irregular hours as needed.

Salary & benefits will be as per the organization’s rules & regulations. Interested candidates are requested to send an application for the Job, along with a motivation letter and a recent resume with a passport-size photo, to the vacancy@voiceofchildren.org.np by 21st December 2025. Only applicants who are short-listed will be contacted for further procedure.

VOC encourages applications from qualified women, members of ethnic minorities or disadvantaged groups.

ANSAB is a civil society organization that has been working for biodiversity conservation and livelihoods improvement across South Asia for three decades. It places community empowerment and economic incentives at the heart of its approach, and has been consistently evolving, consolidating, institutionalizing and advancing the approaches and strategies for the promotion of community-based enterprises and value chains, natural resources management and biodiversity conservation, enabling policy environment and multi-stakeholders.

ANSAB is currently seeking young, energetic and career-oriented candidates for the following position to be based in Kathmandu. The detail of the position with responsibilities, essential skills and qualifications are as follows:

Position: Communication Officer

Duty Station: Kathmandu, Nepal

Required No.: 1

Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary

The Communication Officer will support ANSAB’s communication and visibility efforts by implementing organizational communication strategies, producing communication products, managing digital platforms, maintaining communication databases, documenting knowledge and impacts, ensuring donor compliance, and integrating communication planning within project design.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

  • Coordinate the implementation and periodic updating of the organizational communication strategy to ensure alignment with ANSAB’s vision, priorities, and external engagement needs.
  • Develop and maintain core communication products, including the organizational capability statement, annual report, newsletter, and other visibility materials.
  • Prepare engaging and impactful content for various purposes such as website updates, press releases, blog articles, project visibility materials, and internal/external communications, in consultation with relevant program teams.
  • Manage ANSAB’s social media platforms and website content, including planning, scheduling, publishing, and optimizing content for audience engagement.
  • Monitor and analyze digital performance (e.g., website analytics, social metrics), and prepare regular digital performance reports with insights and recommendations.
  • Maintain and update databases, including donors, partners, media organizations, project portfolios, and Impact Tracking System (ITS).
  • Document best practices, impact stories, case studies, and lessons from project interventions across regions.
  • Develop and curate digital asset library (photos, videos, graphics, documents) for easy retrieval and use in communication products.
  • Ensure all communication outputs and visibility materials comply with donor branding requirements and project visibility guidelines.
  • Work with other program colleagues to ensure communications efforts are coordinated and to gather timely inputs/content for communication outputs.

Requirements and Qualifications

  • Master’s degree, preferably in Communication, Development Studies, or a related field.
  • Three years of professional experience in communications, preferably in the development sector.
  • Experience in content creation for websites, newsletters, press releases, blogs, and promotional materials.
  • Strong writing, editing, and storytelling skills.
  • Proficiency in digital media management and analytics; experience with social media tools and content scheduling platforms.
  • Familiarity with database management systems and digital asset management.
  • Experience with graphic design and multimedia tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Creative Suite) is an advantage.

Qualified candidates meeting the above requirements may apply by sending the latest curriculum vitae along with two references and a cover letter including expected gross salary to email address jobs@ansab.org.np clearly mentioning the position applying in the subject line by December 31, 2025.

ANSAB is an equal opportunity employer and doesn’t discriminate any applicant with regards to caste, race, color, or religion. Priority will be given to the candidates from the project area and disadvantaged groups without compromising the merits and ability to perform the tasks efficiently and effectively. Potential female candidates are highly encouraged to apply for this position.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for written test and interview. No telephone enquiries will be entertained.

Position: Research and Development Assistant

This is an excellent entry-level opportunity for individuals who are passionate about marketing,  product innovation, and consumer insights.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct in-depth market research to understand consumer preferences, industry trends, and competitive positioning within the  Confectionary sector.
  • Assist in collecting and analyzing consumer feedback through surveys, interviews, and field research.
  • Support the ideation and development of new products and the enhancement of existing offerings.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including production, quality assurance, and sales to align product development with market demand.
  • Analyze internal and external data to provide actionable insights that guide product strategies and marketing campaigns.

Qualification:

  • Bachelor’s degree Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • No prior experience required.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is essential.
  • Must hold a valid driver’s license and have access to a two-wheeler for field research and market visits.

Key Skills:

  • Strong analytical thinking with a passion for consumer behavior and product trends.
  • Creative mindset with an eye for detail and a drive for continuous improvement.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Apply now and become a part of our commitment to quality and innovation.
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps in the recruitment process.

Position: Staff Nurse

Purpose of the Job:

The primary aim of this nursing role is to deliver high-quality care to patients in partnership with the healthcare team at The Leprosy Mission Nepal. This involves not only addressing the medical needs of patients but also contributing to their overall healing journey, all while aligning with the organization’s vision and mission.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Deliver direct patient care and support healthcare teams in executing treatment plans.
  • Monitor patients’ health conditions, administer medications, and accurately document patient progress.
  • Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other professionals to achieve optimal patient outcomes.
  • Educate patients and their families on health management and treatment options.
  • Ensure a safe and clean environment by adhering to infection control protocols and safety standards.
  • Maintain thorough documentation of patient care activities, including assessments and interventions.
  • Participate in ongoing education and training to enhance nursing skills and knowledge.
  • Exhibit empathy, compassion, and professionalism in interactions with patients, families, and colleagues.
  • Perform additional tasks as assigned by the line manager.

Job Specification:

  • PCL Nursing Graduates from a recognized institution, registered with the Nepal Nursing Council (NMC).
  • 1 year experience in Clinical nursing in a hospital or healthcare setting preferred.
  • Priority will be given to candidates with experience in Operating Theater Nursing, Pediatric Nursing, or Medical-Surgical Nursing.
  • Strong clinical abilities, including patient assessment, medication administration, and wound care.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment.
  • Proficiency in medical documentation and record-keeping.
  • Knowledge of infection control practices and patient safety protocols.

Safeguarding Statement:

TLM Nepal has a zero-tolerance policy towards any abuse, neglect, and exploitation to all people. Safeguarding is everyone’s responsibility, and all employees are required to act in such a way that always safeguards the health and wellbeing of children and vulnerable adults. The post holder must sign, be familiar with, and comply with all TLM organisational policies, including the Safeguarding Code of Conduct, Safeguarding Children & Vulnerable Adults Policy, and the Safeguarding Children & Vulnerable Adults Procedures. All TLM Nepal staff are required to participate in mandatory safeguarding training.

Position: Crop Technician
Closure Date: 23/Dec/2025, 4:44:00 AM
Organizational Unit: FANEP – FAO Representation in Nepal
Job Type: Non-staff opportunities
Type of Requisition: NPP (National Project Personnel)
Grade Level: N/A
Primary Location: Various Locations-Various Locations
Duration: 12 months
Post Number: N/A

IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please note that Closure Date and Time displayed above are based on date and time settings of your personal device

FAO is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality, background and culture
Qualified female applicants, qualified nationals of non-and under-represented Members and person with disabilities are encouraged to apply
Everyone who works for FAO is required to adhere to the highest standards of integrity and professional conduct, and to uphold FAO’s values
FAO, as a Specialized Agency of the United Nations, has a zero-tolerance policy for conduct that is incompatible with its status, objectives and mandate, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination
All selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks
All applications will be treated with the strictest confidentiality
FAO’s commitment to environmental sustainability is integral to our strategic objectives and operations.

Organizational Setting

The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) contributes to the achievement of the 2030 Agenda through the FAO Strategic Framework by supporting the transformation to MORE efficient, inclusive, resilient and sustainable agrifood systems, for better production, better nutrition, a better environment and a better life, leaving no one behind.

FAO is a specialized agency of the UN that leads international efforts to defeat hunger. FAO’s goal is to achieve food security for all and ensure that people have regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives. With 195 Members (194 countries and the European Union), FAO works in over 130 countries worldwide.

FAO Country Offices, working under overall corporate guidance and in line with the Strategic Framework, offer policy advice and support to countries in the mandated areas of FAO, facilitated through partnerships, resources and an active country programme to provide technical assistance, develop capacities and deliver core services while fully observing international standards of accountability to establish leadership and strengthen impact at the country level.

The offices deliver on the programmatic priorities of each country as agreed in their respective Country Programming Frameworks (CPFs) aligned to the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) and ensure effective and efficient operations with adequate human and financial resources.

Specifically, FAO Country Offices:

(i) advocate, inform and support policies and investments in the areas of FAO’s mandate.
(ii) provide technical assistance and deliver core services.
(iii) assist and catalyse partnership and resource mobilization activities to support agrifood systems transformation.
(iv) position FAO as the specialized/authoritative technical agency in food and agriculture and agrifood systems transformation.
(v) ensure risk-smart and accountable operations and management.

There are three available positions in the following districts: Dolakha (Melung Rural Municipality), Dhanusha (Janaknandini Rural Municipality), and Sindhupalchowk (Sunkoshi Rural Municipality). Applicants are required to indicate their preferred Rural Municipality (RM) in their motivation letter.

Reporting Lines

Under the overall supervision of the FAO Representative in Nepal, the direct supervision of the Project Team Leader with technical guidance of Cluster Crop Value Chain Specialist and in coordination with Crop Production Specialist, the Crop Technician will perform the following tasks.

Technical Focus

As a Crop Technician, the candidate has to assist in the planning and execution of field operations including planting, cultivating, and harvesting by implementing crop management practices to optimize growth conditions, such as fertilization, irrigation, and pest control through regular field inspections and data collections.

Tasks and responsibilities

  •  Form/ identify producer groups for implementation of crop related interventions of the project,
  • Conduct group level orientation/meeting to sensitize on project activities as per the guidance from PCU,
  • Mobilize crop FFS groups for crop FFS and other training in line with work plan of the FANSEP/FAO-TA Project,
  •  Identify lead farmers from the FFS, and facilitate their participation in additional refresher training,
  •  Facilitate groups formation and registration process in concerned rural municipalities and provide group strengthening support,
  • Facilitate producer groups in developing proposals/business plan for accessing matching grant support from the project,
  •  Mobilize crop producer groups for demonstration, seed production and other crop productivity improvement related training and other activities as per approved annual work plan of PCU and FAO-TA,
  • Prepare and submit trimester and monthly work plan and monthly progress report as per the format developed by the project,
  •  Identify demonstrations sites, coordinate with PCUs for the timely distribution of quality inputs to producer groups,
  •  Assist PCU in implementation of the seed multiplication, crop cutting data collection, and small scale irrigation related activities (including deep boring installation),
  •  Assist PCU in collection of baseline data from field level, conduction of assessment and surveys
  •  Provide technical services to members of producer groups on crop production related activities,
  •  Monitor the crop related interventions implemented by the producer groups and prepare monthly progress reports on the project related activities,
  •  Collect and report field level data required for PMIS to Cluster-based Crop Value Chain Specialist on monthly basis,
  • Prepare and submit Trimester and monthly plan to PCU and cluster-based Crop Value Chain Specialist as per the format developed by the project,
  •  Assist in conducting on-farm demonstration and collect data on crop productivity related parameters as per the given template,
  •  Report on progress in the use of funds disbursed to the producer groups by the PCU under matching grants,
  •  Support PCUs to mobilize multi-stakeholder dialogue platform and productive alliances for market linkages,
  •  Monitor ESMF compliance of crop related activities and prepare periodic report,
  •  Implement awareness raising activities on environment and social issues and safeguard aspects and collect information as per project requirement,
  •  Undertake other project related tasks as assigned by PCU chief, PCU staffs and FAO TA-Team

CANDIDATES WILL BE ASSESSED AGAINST THE FOLLOWING

Minimum Requirements

  •  High School Diploma/Technical Diploma (equivalent to SLC/TSLC) in Agriculture relevant with JTA
  •  At least two years of working experience in assisting the implementation of field operations and crop management, pest and disease management, irrigation and water management, post-harvest handling and of experience in agriculture development projects activities
  •  Working knowledge of English and Nepali, knowledge of local language will be an advantage
  •  National of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal

FAO Core Competencies

  •  Results Focus
  •  Teamwork
  •  Communication
  •  Building Effective Relationships
  •  Knowledge Sharing and Continuous Improvement

Technical/Functional Skills

  • Work experience in more than one location or area of work
  •  Work experience in farmer groups formation and mobilization
  •  Strong knowledge of sustainable agricultural practices to enhance environmental health and long-term productivity.
  •  Good knowledge of communication and documentation standards.
  •  Good knowledge of the organizational structure.

Selection Criteria

  •  Demonstrated practical and technical experience in crop productions with major experience of biological control research, extension, and development on the day-to-day operational activities of the project or programmes.
  •  Good knowledge of computer operation of the MS Office applications, Internet and office technology equipment
  • Extent of technical and practical experience on the day-to-day operational activities of the project or programmes.
  •  Communication, writing and presentation skills in English and Nepali.
  •  Ability to work with a multidisciplinary and multicultural team.
  • Prior work experience with UN agencies, development partners, banks, and government of Nepal.
  • High degree of team ethics, well-organized, result focused and dynamic personality.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

FAO does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruitment process (application, interview meeting, processing)
Applications received after the closing date will not be accepted
Please note that FAO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU) / United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed at http://www.whed.net/
For additional employment opportunities visit the FAO employment website: http://www.fao.org/employment/home/en/
Appointment will be subject to certification that the candidate is medically fit for appointment, accreditation, any residency or visa requirements, and security clearances.

FAO seeks gender, geographical and linguistic diversity in its staff and international consultants in order to best serve FAO Members in all regions.

HOW TO APPLY

  •  To apply, visit the recruitment website at Jobs at FAO and complete your online profile. We strongly recommend that your profile is accurate, complete and includes your employment records, academic qualifications, and language skills
  •  Candidates are requested to attach a letter of motivation to the online profile
  • Once your profile is completed, please apply, and submit your application
  • Please note that FAO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU) / United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed at http://www.whed.net/. These qualifications should be in alignment with the International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED) mappings.
  • Candidates may be requested to provide performance assessments and authorization to conduct verification checks of past and present work, character, education, military and police records to ascertain any and all information which may be pertinent to the employment qualifications
  • Incomplete applications will not be considered
  • Personal information provided on your application may be shared within FAO and with other companies acting on FAO’s behalf to provide employment support services such as pre-screening of applications, assessment tests, background checks and other related services. You will be asked to provide your consent before submitting your application. You may withdraw consent at any time, by withdrawing your application, in such case FAO will no longer be able to consider your application
  •  Only applications received through the FAO recruitment portal will be considered
  • Your application will be screened based on the information provided in your online profile
  • We encourage applicants to submit the application well before the deadline date.

If you need help or have queries, please create a one-time registration with FAO’s client support team for further assistance: https://fao.service-now.com/csp

FAO IS A NON-SMOKING ENVIRONMENT

title.rendered: Community Counselors, MEAL Officer, National Project Manager, Field Coordinator

content.rendered:
ADRA, the global humanitarian organisation, is dedicated to delivering relief and development support to individuals in more than 118 countries – regardless of their ethnicity, political affiliation, gender, or religious association. By partnering with local communities, organisations, and governments, we ensure our programs are culturally appropriate and empower local capacities for sustainable change.

In Nepal, ADRA has been a trusted development partner for over 38 years, with expertise in health, livelihoods, education, and disaster risk management. We work with all three levels of government and with civil society nationwide, with a focus on the provinces of Madhesh, Bagmati, Lumbini, Karnali, and Sudurpaschim.

ADRA Nepal requires the following positions for the Core Group Partner Project (CGPP). CGPP, in collaboration with implementing partners and provincial/municipal governments, is implementing a comprehensive community-based surveillance project focusing on immunization, surveillance, zoonotic diseases, VPDs, cross-border health screening, and One Health integration.

ADRA Nepal invites applications from qualified and experienced Nepalese citizens for the following positions:

1. National Project Manager: One

Station: Based in Country Office, Bakhundol, Lalitpur

The National Project Manager, reporting to the Program Director, will lead and support the implementation of the Core Group Partner Project (CGPP). The role includes strategic and technical oversight, coordination with national and global health stakeholders, and management of surveillance, immunization, MCH, and GHS activities. The manager will facilitate regular coordination meetings and ensure immunization and surveillance.

For the details of the job description, please click on this link: https://bit.ly/48Abynm

Please click on this link for the job application form: https://adra.formalto.app/X9G4uzAUcn

Qualifications and Competencies:

Master’s in public health or related field with a minimum of 7 years of work experience in public health program management; strong experience with the MoHP and donor-funded projects; proven leadership in multi-partner programs; knowledge of MCH, DHIS2, surveillance, and outbreak response; excellent communication skills; fluency in English and Nepali.

2.Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability, and Learning (MEAL) Officer: One

Station: based in Madhesh Province

MEAL Officer will Lead routine monitoring across municipalities, health facilities, and community outreach activities; Ensure timely and accurate data collection for immunization, AFP surveillance, VPDs, and zoonotic alerts; Implement Data Quality Assurance (DQAs) and support corrective action planning; document good practices, success stories, and lessons learned to inform adaptive management; strengthen community engagement through FCHVs, CHWs, schools, and community structures; prepare inputs for provincial reviews, stakeholder meetings, and SWC visit.

For the details of the job description, please click on this link: https://bit.ly/4iQKpzX

For the job application, please send an email to this mailing address: https://adra.formalto.app/X9G4uzAUcn

Qualifications and Competencies:

Bachelor’s degree in public health, Statistics, Epidemiology or related discipline (Master’s preferred); 3–5 years of MEAL experience in health programs, preferably maternal and children health/ immunization; strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SPSS, or similar; experience with mobile data collection tools (ODK, Kobo, DHIS2); ability to manage multiple tasks and work in remote, challenging environments; strong communication skills in Nepali and English.

3.Field Coordinator: One

Station: Position for Partner organization

The Field Coordinator (based in Madhesh Province) will support community-based surveillance, including Immunization, VPD, and zoonotic disease reporting; assist routine immunization activities, microplanning, and follow-up of zero-dose and under-immunized children; coordinate with municipalities, health facilities, animal health workers, and one health committees; ensure timely reporting and compliance with donor and safeguarding standards; and represent the local NGO in district and municipal meetings.

For the details of the job description, please click on this link: https://bit.ly/454p4x5

For the job application, please send an email to this mailing address: partners@adranepal.org

Qualifications and Competencies:

Bachelor’s in public health or related field (Master preferred); at least 5 years’ experience in community health, immunization, surveillance, or NGO work; familiarity with FCHVs and local health systems in Madhesh Province; knowledge of MCH, routine immunization, CBS, and One Health; skills in data/reporting (DHIS2 preferred); strong communication and coordination abilities.

4.Community Counselors: One

Station: Position for Partner organization, based in Madhesh Province

The Community Counselors (based in Madhesh Province) will identify and follow up on zero-dose and partially immunized children, mobilize caregivers for routine and supplementary immunization, and coordinate with FCHVs and health facilities to improve vaccination coverage. They will report alerts, counsel pregnant and postpartum women, conduct small-group awareness sessions, promote hygiene and MCH practices, and address myths and vaccine hesitancy within communities.

For the details of the job description, please click on this link: https://bit.ly/44ld2iL

For the job application, please send an email to this mailing address: partners@adranepal.org

Qualifications and Competencies:

PCL Nursing/ANM or related field; minimum 3 years’ experience in community or public health (especially MCH and immunization); knowledge of immunization and MNCH; basic digital reporting skills; strong communication in Maithili and Nepali; local candidates preferred.

“ADRA is a Child Safe Organization with zero tolerance for child abuse and screens applicants for suitability to work with children.”

Applications must be submitted no later than 19 December 2025

Only short-listed candidates will be called for further screening.

ADRA Nepal reserves the right to accept or reject applications during the screening process.

Telephone enquiries will not be entertained.

Position: IT Operations Assistant, SC L5

DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS: 24 December 2025-23:59-GMT+05:45 Nepal Time (Kathmandu)

WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.

ABOUT WFP

The World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP’s values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.

To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org and follow us on social media to keep up with our latest news: YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok.

WHY JOIN WFP?

  • WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
  • WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.
  • WFP invests in the personal & professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.
  • A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
  • We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).

WFP encourages female candidates and people with disabilities to apply.

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE OF THE ASSIGNMENT:

To deliver high quality technical support, system and data maintenance across a range of areas, in order to contribute to the effective delivery of IT services.

TERMS AND CONDITION

Position Title: IT Operations Assistant

Contract Type: Service Contract (SC)
Level: SC L5

Contract Duration: 12 months

Duty Station: Kathmandu

Date of Publication: 11.12.2025
Deadline of Application: 24.12.2025
WFP offers a competitive benefits package including salary plus CIGNA health insurance

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under the overall guidance of the Country Director and the direct supervision of Head of IT Operations Officer, the incumbent will be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Provide technical support for the installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of IT and telecommunications systems, including servers, LAN/WAN networks, VSATs, optical fiber links, and power backup equipment, ensuring systems operate efficiently and in accordance with WFP standards.
  • Conduct routine system diagnostics, perform software and hardware updates, and monitor network performance to ensure service reliability; assist in responding to basic cybersecurity incidents as per corporate guidance.
  • Serve as a focal point for information and content management using SharePoint and other WFP digital platforms, supporting data collection, processing, and reporting to facilitate informed decision-making.
  • Manage IT assets and inventories, including tagging, registration, verification, and reconciliation, ensuring updates are accurately reflected in corporate systems in line with WFP asset management policies.
  • Deliver Level 1 and Level 2 technical support to end users, escalating unresolved or complex issues as necessary. Support workshops, meetings, and official events by providing IT setup, connectivity, and troubleshooting assistance.
  • Assist in IT-related procurement and budgeting by preparing technical specifications, tracking financial transactions, and ensuring timely delivery and documentation of goods and services.
  • Maintain up-to-date records of IT documentation, licenses, configurations, and ensure compliance with WFP administrative procedures, information security policies, and audit requirements.
  • Collaborate with Administration, Finance, and Procurement units to facilitate timely and compliant procurement of IT and telecommunications goods and services.
  • Support the development of standard material such as training documentation and Web content on behalf of senior officers, to ensure staff have access to required information about IT services and products.
  • Support the rollout and adoption of WFP corporate applications and digital tools by coordinating with field teams and providing basic training and guidance to users.
  • Provide support in service improvement by identifying recurring technical issues, proposing preventive measures, and supporting continuous improvement of IT operations.
  • Work collaboratively with other IT staff to ensure smooth and uninterrupted IT service delivery and operational continuity across the office and field locations.
  • Maintain organized and secure digital and physical filing systems for IT administrative and operational records.
  • Support emergency preparedness and response activities by ensuring IT/TC services remain functional and aligned with business continuity and emergency protocols.
  • Perform other related duties as required to support the delivery of effective and efficient IT services in line with WFP’s goals and operational requirements.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Education:

  • Completion of secondary school education. A post-secondary certificate in the related functional area and any university degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology is desirable.

Experience:

  • At least five years of relevant work experience.
  • More years of experience with professional certification (IT Service Management, Cloud & Infrastructure, Systems & Network Administration, Information
  • Security, CISCO, Microsoft certification) is considered an added value.
  • Assisted in gathering user requirements and recommending basic automation and optimization solutions.
  • Experienced in using service desk and ticketing systems to manage user requests and system events; familiarity with Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) practices is an added advantage.
  • Involved in country office-level procurement, property surveys, and budgeting forums.
  • Deployed and maintained IT/TC systems including VSAT, radios, CCTV, PABX, firewalls, and server/network infrastructure.
  • Proficient in deploying and managing cloud platforms like Office 365, SharePoint, Azure, Cisco Networks, SDN, and SD-WAN.
  • Experienced with cybersecurity and information security solutions and their deployment.
  • Contributed to technical documentation, project briefs, and user guides.
  • Supported IT events, training, and simulation exercises.
  • Exposure to emergency response or humanitarian missions is considered an added value.
  • Engaged in small-scale IT projects and built strong working relationships with stakeholders.

Languages: Excellent written and spoken English and Nepali languages.

WFP LEADERSHIP FRAMEWORK

WFP Leadership Framework guides to the common standards of behavior that guide HOW we work together to accomplish our mission.

Click here to access WFP Leadership Framework
REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION

WFP is committed to supporting individuals with disabilities by providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process. If you require a reasonable accommodation, please contact: global.inclusion@wfp.org

NO FEE DISCLAIMER

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

REMINDERS BEFORE YOU SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION

  • All applications must be submitted exclusively through our online recruitment system. We do not accept CVs or spontaneous applications by email.
  • If you experience challenges while submitting your online application, please contact us at global.hrerecruitment@wfp.org for technical support only.
  • Please note that applications sent to this email address cannot be considered.
  • We strongly recommend that your profile is accurate, complete, and includes your employment records, academic qualifications, language skills and UN Grade (if applicable).
  • Once your profile is completed, please apply, and submit your application.
  • Please make sure you upload your professional CV in the English language
  • Kindly note the only documents you will need to submit at this time are your CV and Cover Letter
  • Additional documents such as passport, recommendation letters, academic certificates, etc. may potentially be requested at a future time
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be notified

All employment decisions are made on the basis of organizational needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications. WFP is committed to providing an inclusive work environment free of sexual exploitation and abuse, all forms of discrimination, any kind of harassment, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. Therefore, all selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

No appointment under any kind of contract will be offered to members of the UN Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), International Civil Service Commission (ICSC), FAO Finance Committee, WFP External Auditor, WFP Audit Committee, Joint Inspection Unit (JIU) and other similar bodies within the United Nations system with oversight responsibilities over WFP, both during their service and within three years of ceasing that service.

Village Development and Save the Environment Forum (VDSEF) Nepal is a non-profit organization working in Kalikot district for more than 31 years in the areas of child rights, health and nutrition, climate change, poverty reduction, and the protection and promotion of economic, social, and cultural rights of marginalized and disadvantaged communities. The organization works to promote peace, stability, and sustainable development in Kalikot. VDSEF Nepal has extensive experience working with civil society organizations and government authorities to improve child rights, health and nutrition, climate change, livelihoods, and human rights of vulnerable groups, including women, single mothers, and youth, and children, persons with disabilities, senior citizens, Dalits, and ethnic minorities.

The SAHAYATRA-III Project is being implemented in Subhakalika Rural Municipality and Tilagufa Municipality in partnership with Save the Children. The project aims to ensure that rural vulnerable children have access to education, protection, resilience, and sexual and reproductive health, leaving no child behind. VDSEF Nepal is currently seeking applications from qualified Nepali citizens committed to delivering results for the following position:

Position: Field officer, Climate change and Green Jobs-1 (One)

Duty station: Project Office, Subhakalika Rural Municipality, Kalikot
Report to: Project Coordinator- Climate change and Green Jobs
Salary and Benefits: As per the organization’s norms commensurate with the project agreement

Summary:

The Field Officer- Climate Change and Green Jobs will support the implementation of the SAHAYATRA-III Project in Subhakalika Rural Municipality. The role focuses on leading and facilitating community-level activities related to climate action, climate resilience, and green livelihood initiatives. The position requires close coordination with local governments, schools, community groups, youth clubs, and public and private sector actors to promote climate-resilient practices and green job opportunities. The Field Officer will also provide onsite coaching and technical support to communities to strengthen sustainable livelihood practices.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead coordination with Palika-level government agencies, including environment, agriculture, education, disaster units, ward offices, schools, and community-based organizations.
  • Facilitate community groups and schools to understand and carry out climate resilience and green job activities.
  • Organize awareness campaigns, environmental assessments, trainings, and workshops at the community level.
  • Conduct technical support visits, providing coaching and mentoring to promote climate-resilient practices.
  • Support local planning and budgeting processes to advocate for climate-focused resource allocation.
  • Prepare periodic reports, case studies, and success stories, and support MEAL processes for tracking progress.

JD Link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/17K-wUQQlWtbrR-s5DeqwSCSmiCxGdExy/view?usp=sharing

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Natural Resource Management, Agriculture, or Climate Change with at least 2 years of relevant work experience

 

OR

  • Intermediate degree in Agriculture, Environmental Science, Natural Resource Management, or Climate Change with at least 4 years of relevant work experience
    Safeguarding obligation:
  • We need to keep children, adult at risk and community safe. The position holder is responsible to ensure that the position holder conduct is in line with the VDSEF and SCI Safeguarding policies. Hence, our selection process includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children, adult at risk and community from abuse, exploitation, and harassment.

Safeguarding our Staff:

The post holder is required to carry out the duties in accordance with the VDSEF and SCI anti-Harassment policy

Application Process:

Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit their updated CV and application, along with two references, via email to vacancy.vdsef@gmail.com or in person at the VDSEF-Nepal Head Office, Khadachakra-1, Manma, Kalikot.

Deadline: 5:00 PM, 17 December 2025

Candidates from marginalized and disadvantaged communities, as well as local residents, are highly encouraged to apply. Preference will be given to applicants with relevant field experience. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and telephone inquiries will not be entertained.

Position: Nutrition Technician
Closure Date: 24/Dec/2025, 4:44:00 AM
Organizational Unit: FANEP – FAO Representation in Nepal
Job Type: Non-staff opportunities
Type of Requisition: NPP (National Project Personnel)
Grade Level: N/A
Primary Location: Nepal-Sindhupalchowk
Duration: 12 months
Post Number: N/A

IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please note that Closure Date and Time displayed above are based on date and time settings of your personal device

FAO is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality, background and culture
Qualified female applicants, qualified nationals of non-and under-represented Members and person with disabilities are encouraged to apply
Everyone who works for FAO is required to adhere to the highest standards of integrity and professional conduct, and to uphold FAO’s values
FAO, as a Specialized Agency of the United Nations, has a zero-tolerance policy for conduct that is incompatible with its status, objectives and mandate, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination
All selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks
All applications will be treated with the strictest confidentiality
FAO’s commitment to environmental sustainability is integral to our strategic objectives and operations.

Organizational Setting

The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) contributes to the achievement of the 2030 Agenda through the FAO Strategic Framework by supporting the transformation to MORE efficient, inclusive, resilient and sustainable agrifood systems, for better production, better nutrition, a better environment and a better life, leaving no one behind.

FAO is a specialized agency of the UN that leads international efforts to defeat hunger. FAO’s goal is to achieve food security for all and ensure that people have regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives. With 195 Members (194 countries and the European Union), FAO works in over 130 countries worldwide.

FAO Country Offices, working under overall corporate guidance and in line with the Strategic Framework, offer policy advice and support to countries in the mandated areas of FAO, facilitated through partnerships, resources and an active country programme to provide technical assistance, develop capacities and deliver core services while fully observing international standards of accountability to establish leadership and strengthen impact at the country level.

The offices deliver on the programmatic priorities of each country as agreed in their respective Country Programming Frameworks (CPFs) aligned to the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) and ensure effective and efficient operations with adequate human and financial resources.

Specifically, FAO Country Offices:

(i) advocate, inform and support policies and investments in the areas of FAO’s mandate.
(ii) provide technical assistance and deliver core services.
(iii) assist and catalyse partnership and resource mobilization activities to support agrifood systems transformation.
(iv) position FAO as the specialized/authoritative technical agency in food and agriculture and agrifood systems transformation.
(v) ensure risk-smart and accountable operations and management.

Reporting Lines

Under the overall supervision of the FAO Representative in Nepal, the direct supervision of the Project Team Leader with technical guidance of Cluster Nutrition Specialist and in coordination with Nutrition Specialist, the Nutrition Technician will perform the following tasks.

Technical Focus

The Nutrition Technician will primarily focus on conducting dietary assessments and anthropometric measurements to evaluate the nutritional status of target communities and maintaining accurate data on food intake, dietary habits, and nutritional health indicators aimed at improving the nutritional status of communities and dietary practices.

Tasks and responsibilities

  •  Form/ identify new nutrition groups and select existing groups (mother groups)
  •  Conduct group level orientation/meeting to sensitize on project activities as per the guidance from PCU
  •  Facilitate groups formation and registration process in concerned rural municipalities and provide group strengthening support,
  •  Facilitate in the planning, implementation of Nutrition Field School (NFS), Home Nutrition Garden (HNG) in the targeted municipalities,
  •  Facilitate nutrition groups in adoption of social and BCC practices,
  •  Facilitate nutrition groups in developing proposals/business plan for accessing small grants from the project,
  •  Prepare and submit a monthly work plan to cluster-based Nutrition Specialist and PCU as per the format developed by the project,
  • Collect and report field level data required for PMIS to cluster-based Nutrition Specialist on monthly basis,
  • Monitor, supervise and prepare monthly progress report on the nutrition related activities of the project,
  •  Coordinate with PCUs for the distribution of inputs/ tools equipment for implementing NFS, establish HNG and implementation of small grants to the beneficiaries,
  •  Implement awareness raising activities on environment and social issues and safeguard aspects, and information/data collection as per the need of the project,
  •  Monitoring of environment and social compliances identified in environment and social management plan,
  •  Report on progress in the use of funds disbursed to the beneficiary groups by the project as instructed and on the progress of business plans and small grant programs,
  •  Support PCUs for the identification of beneficiaries, formation of nutrition groups in new RMs for the implementation of FANSEP II interventions,
  • Collect and report field level data required for PMIS to Cluster Nutrition Specialist Team on monthly basis,
  •  Undertake other project related tasks as assigned by PCU chief, PCU staffs and FAO TA-Team

CANDIDATES WILL BE ASSESSED AGAINST THE FOLLOWING

Minimum Requirements

  •  High School Diploma/Technical Diploma (equivalent to SLC) TSLC Health education Nutrition related
  •  At least two years of working experience in development project, social mobilization or awareness activities
  •  Working knowledge of English and Nepali
  • National of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal

FAO Core Competencies

  •  Results Focus
  • Teamwork
  •  Communication
  •  Building Effective Relationships
  •  Knowledge Sharing and Continuous Improvement

Technical/Functional Skills

  •  Strong understanding of nutritional science, dietary guidelines, and the nutritional needs of target areas.
  •  Meticulous in conducting nutritional assessments, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring data integrity.
  •  Ability to effectively communicate nutritional information to clients and community members.
  •  Proficient in preparing reports and educational materials.
  •  Capable of managing multiple tasks, prioritizing workload, and adhering to deadlines.
  • Good knowledge of communication and documentation standards.
  • Good knowledge of the organizational structure.

Selection Criteria

  •  Knowledge of local language will be an advantage.
  •  Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and with a multidisciplinary and multicultural team.
  •  Proficiency in collecting dietary data and maintain accurate records and analyzing nutritional information to support research and program development.
  •  Assisted in the implementation and evaluation of nutrition programs, including preparing educational materials, organizing workshops, and coordinating with other health professionals.
  •  Good knowledge of computer operation of the MS Office applications, Internet and office technology equipment
  •  Extent of technical and practical experience on the day-to-day operational activities of the project or programmes.
  •  Communication, writing and presentation skills in English and Nepali.
  •  Prior work experience with UN agencies, development partners, banks, and government of Nepal.
  •  High degree of team ethics, well-organized, result focused and dynamic personality

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

  • FAO does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruitment process (application, interview meeting, processing)
  • Applications received after the closing date will not be accepted
  • Please note that FAO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU) / United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed at http://www.whed.net/
  • For additional employment opportunities visit the FAO employment website: http://www.fao.org/employment/home/en/
  • Appointment will be subject to certification that the candidate is medically fit for appointment, accreditation, any residency or visa requirements, and security clearances.

FAO seeks gender, geographical and linguistic diversity in its staff and international consultants in order to best serve FAO Members in all regions.

HOW TO APPLY

•

  • To apply, visit the recruitment website at Jobs at FAO and complete your online profile. We strongly recommend that your profile is accurate, complete and includes your employment records, academic qualifications, and language skills
  •  Candidates are requested to attach a letter of motivation to the online profile
  • Once your profile is completed, please apply, and submit your application
  •  Please note that FAO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU) / United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed at http://www.whed.net/. These qualifications should be in alignment with the International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED) mappings.
  •  Candidates may be requested to provide performance assessments and authorization to conduct verification checks of past and present work, character, education, military and police records to ascertain any and all information which may be pertinent to the employment qualifications
  •  Incomplete applications will not be considered
  •  Personal information provided on your application may be shared within FAO and with other companies acting on FAO’s behalf to provide employment support services such as pre-screening of applications, assessment tests, background checks and other related services. You will be asked to provide your consent before submitting your application. You may withdraw consent at any time, by withdrawing your application, in such case FAO will no longer be able to consider your application
  •  Only applications received through the FAO recruitment portal will be considered
  • Your application will be screened based on the information provided in your online profile
  • We encourage applicants to submit the application well before the deadline date.

If you need help or have queries, please create a one-time registration with FAO’s client support team for further assistance: https://fao.service-now.com/csp

HEARD Nepal is a humanitarian NGO, registered under the Registration of Institutions Act 2034 BS. Affiliated with the Social Welfare Council, Kathmandu (Affiliation No: 52601) and PAN No: 615996712. Registered office: Rajbiraj, Saptari; provincial field offices: Biratnagar, Morang; Sukedhara, Kathmandu; Birendranagar, Surkhet, Karnali Province.

Project: Nutrition for Life – N4L

HEARD Nepal in partnership with Helen Keller International, is implementing Nutrition For Life- N4L (जीवनकालागि पोषण) Program in Saptari District, Madhesh Province. Covering all 18 local governments. The project aims to reduce acute malnutrition among pregnant women and children under five by strengthening local health systems, expanding community-based nutrition services, and promoting optimal Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) practices. Activities include mass screenings, home-to-home case management, improving inpatient/rehabilitation services, ensuring supply chain reliability, supporting underweight pregnant women, IFA supplementation, and capacity building for health workers and FCHVs. Coordination with local governments and key stakeholders (FWD/MoHP, Provincial Health Directorate, Health Offices) ensures sustainability.

HEARD Nepal invites applications for the following positions under the N4L project

Admin & Finance Officer (Women candidates are strongly encouraged to apply)

No. of Positions: 1

Reports To: Program Coordinator / Executive Director

Duty Station: Saptari, Madhesh Province

Type of Contract: Full-time (Fixed Term)

Duty Station: PNGOs office

Reports To: Program Coordinator / Finance/Admin Manager

Overall Purpose of the Role

The Admin & Finance Officer is responsible for supporting accurate financial management, administrative operations, and compliance within the PNGO. The role ensures timely recording, reporting, and reconciliation of financial transactions; supports budgeting and audit processes; and maintains efficient administrative systems in alignment with organizational policies and national regulations.

Key Responsibilities

A. Financial Management

  • Record, verify, and update financial transactions, ensuring completeness, accuracy, and compliance with organizational policies and national laws.
  • Prepare vouchers, maintain ledgers, reconcile accounts, and manage cash/bank transactions.
  • Prepare periodic financial reports (e.g., monthly, quarterly, annual) and submit them to management and relevant stakeholders on time.
  • Support budget preparation, budget monitoring, and expenditure tracking.
  • Ensure timely payroll processing, payment of suppliers, and settlement of advances.
  • Maintain proper documentation, filing, and backup of all financial records (both digital and hard copies).
  • Ensure compliance with donor requirements, internal control procedures, and statutory obligations (including TDS and tax rules).
  • Support internal, external, and donor audits through timely preparation and submission of relevant documents.
  • Use financial/accounting software (e.g., FAMAS or similar) to maintain up-to-date accounts.

B. Administrative Support

  • Support procurement processes, inventory updates, and asset management in accordance with organizational procedures.
  • Assist in maintaining office administration, logistics, and record-keeping systems.
  • Coordinate travel, meeting arrangements, and administrative support for project teams.
  • Ensure proper maintenance of office equipment, supplies, and administrative services.

C. Capacity Support & Compliance

  • Provide guidance to project and field staff on financial procedures, documentation standards, and compliance requirements.
  • Support the development and improvement of internal control systems and administrative procedures.
  • Conduct or support trainings for finance and non-finance staff when needed.

D. Other Duties

  • Perform additional tasks as required to support finance, administration, and organizational operations.

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Studies, Accounting, Finance, or a related field (BBA/BBS) (Master’s preferred- MBA/MBS).
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in finance and administration, preferably in NGO/INGO or development projects.
  • Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting, budgeting, and audit procedures.
  • Experience using accounting software (e.g., Truebook, FAMAS, Tally, or similar).
  • Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel.
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
  • Good communication skills in both English and Nepali.
  • Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and handle multiple priorities.
  • Ability to work under pressure and occasionally outside standard hours.

Key Competencies

  • Attention to detail and high integrity
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality
  • Result-oriented and proactive approach.
  • Application Instructions (Human Resource Department )

Required Documents: Updated Resume (CV), Academic Certificates, Cover Letter outlining experience and commitment

Email: vacancy@heardnepal.org

Subject Line: “Application for [Job Title]” in subject

Notes:

  • Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
  • HEARD Nepal reserves the right to accept or reject applications.
  • Telephone inquiries will not be entertained.

Priority Consideration:

Local candidates from marginalized communities (Dalit women, gender/sexual minorities, PWDs, Madhesi, Tharu, Muslim, Janajati) encouraged to apply.
